--- == GPS Tracker By Ms.Ami Tusharkant Choksi == === Introduction === We want to track a person. For that, GPS(Global Positioning System) tracker is useful. The output of GPS tracker is in the form of latitude and longitude. They are the real numbers, that we cannot understand easily. To make it understandable easily, if places of those locations with names as text and map is shown, humans can understand very easily. That's what we are implementing here. === Explanation for Code === --- To implement GPS tracker in Python language, we need
  • csv file, wherein latitude and longitude are available
  • gmplot python module should be install
  • generate HTML file, that contains the Google map output of all data of route.csv file
  • browser wherein we will see output
--- === route.csv === route.csv file, as shared by Amitsir, is having data in the following format. 
28.689519,77.324495
28.689431,77.324347
28.689316,77.324165
28.689285,77.324062
28.689218,77.323948
28.689343,77.323858
28.689431,77.323807

import csv
reader = csv.reader(f)

        long = float(row[1])
=== Use of gmplot module === Check whether gmplot is installed or not on your system. For that on your python shell, write, 
from gmplot import gmplot
If it, gives any error, it means, gmplot module is not installed on your machine. One can install gmplot using 
pip3 install gmplot
on Ubuntu or linux compatible machines. The required code for generating HTML file, from google map is as follows: 

# import gmplot package 
import gmplot 
  
# GoogleMapPlotter return Map object 
# Pass the center latitude and 
# center longitude 
gmap = gmplot.GoogleMapPlotter(28.689169, 77.324448,17)
#set icon set Google marker icon
gmap.coloricon = "http://www.googlemapsmarkers.com/v1/%s/"

gmap.marker(lat,long,'yellow') #setting the marker of yellow color for start
Setting the marker for start as yellow color, last as red and others as blue color.
Generate the HTML file that has the google map output of all data of route.csv file 
gmap.draw("mymap.html")
--- === Code === 
import csv
#check if module is available or not
#on python shell
#from gmplot import gmplot        
#if not available, install it
#pip3 install gmplot        

from gmplot import gmplot
gmap = gmplot.GoogleMapPlotter(28.689169, 77.324448,17)
gmap.coloricon = "http://www.googlemapsmarkers.com/v1/%s/"
        
with open("route.csv","r") as f:
    reader = csv.reader(f)
    k=0
    for row in reader:
        lat = float(row[0])
        long = float(row[1])
        #print(lat)
        #print(long)
        #print()
        if(k==0):
            gmap.marker(lat,long,'yellow')
            k=1
        else:
            gmap.marker
            (lat,long,'blue')
gmap.marker(lat,long,'red')            
gmap.draw("mymap.html")

'''Board:''' The game is having board with numbers ranging from 1 to 100. Snakes and ladders are placed on the board in any direction, ranging from any number to any other number on the board.
'''Player:''' Each player has to roll a dice. Position of player, e.g. player1's cookie will be placed on new position, i.e. calculated from 
new position=current position + diceNumber
'''Snake or Ladder:''' There can be snake or ladder on the new position. If snake is there, user has to go down to the position of snake's tail. If ladder is there, user will reach to the position of top of the ladder. '''Win or loose:''' A player who reaches the number 100 on the board first, wins the game. === Explanation for the Code: === Vidyamam, in the lecture, taught us to create a board by loading the image on it. from PIL import Image
import random
end=100

#show board image in a window

    snakeLadder = random.randint(2,80)
    divisor = random.randint(2,9)
    #if ladder is there, return +snakeLadder

        print("Sorry Snake : ",snakeLadder)
        return(-snakeLadder)
    #neither snake or ladder is there
    else:
        print("Neither snake nor ladder : ")
        return 0    
#play
def play():
    #input player names
    p1Name=input("Player1 Name : ")
    p2Name=input("Players Name : ")
    #initial points of players
    p1=0
    p2=0
    turn=0
    while(1):
        if(turn%2==0):
            print(p1Name, " Your turn")
            c = input("Press 1 to continue, 0 to exit : ")
            if(c==0):
                print(p1Name," Scored : ",p1)
                print(p2Name," Scored : ",p2)
                print("Quiting the game, bye")
                break
            #generate random number for dice
            dice = random.randint(1,6)
            print("Dice showed : ",dice)
            
            p1 = p1+dice
            p1 += check_snakeLadder()
            #after snake if, p1 becomes negative, make it 0,
            #as -ve is not available on board
            if(p1<0):
                p1=0
            
            if p1>end:
                p1=end
            print(p1Name, " Your Score : ",p1)
            if(reached_end(p1)):
                print(p1Name, " won")
                break
        else:
            print(p2Name, " Your turn")
            c = input("Press 1 to continue, 0 to exit : ")
            if(c==0):
                print(p1Name," Scored : ",p1)
                print(p2Name," Scored : ",p2)
                print("Quiting the game, bye")
                break
            #generate random number for dice
            dice = random.randint(1,6)
            print("Dice showed : ",dice)
            
            p2 = p2+dice
            p2 += check_snakeLadder() 
            #after snake if, p1 becomes negative, make it 0,
            #as -ve is not available on board
            if(p2<0):
                p2=0
            
            if p2>end:
                p2=end
            print(p2Name, " Your Score : ",p2)
            if(reached_end(p2)):
                print(p2Name, " won")
                break
        turn+=1
#calling the board and play methods
show_board()    
play()

== GPS Tracker By Ms.Ami Tusharkant Choksi ==
=== Introduction ===
We want to track a person. For that, GPS(Global Positioning System) tracker is useful. The output of GPS tracker is in the form of latitude and longitude. They are the real numbers, that we cannot understand easily. To make it understandable easily, if places of those locations with names as text and map is shown, humans can understand very easily. That's what we are implementing here. 
=== Explanation for Code ===
---
To implement GPS tracker in Python language, we need 

    

  • csv file, wherein latitude and longitude are available
    • 

  • gmplot python module should be install
    • 

  • generate HTML file, that contains the Google map output of all data of route.csv file

  • browser wherein we will see output
    • 


---

=== route.csv ===
route.csv file, as shared by Amitsir, is having data in the following format.

28.689519,77.324495
28.689431,77.324347
28.689316,77.324165
28.689285,77.324062
28.689218,77.323948
28.689343,77.323858
28.689431,77.323807


---

=== read csv file ===
Import the csv module and using the reader get values of longtitude and latitude from file.

import csv
reader = csv.reader(f)
    k=0
    for row in reader:
        lat = float(row[0])
        long = float(row[1])


=== Use of gmplot module ===
Check whether gmplot is installed or not on your system. For that on your python shell, write, 

from gmplot import gmplot


If it, gives any error, it means, gmplot module is not installed on your machine. One can install gmplot using

pip3 install gmplot


on Ubuntu or linux compatible machines. The required code for generating HTML file, from google map is as follows:


# import gmplot package 
import gmplot 
  
# GoogleMapPlotter return Map object 
# Pass the center latitude and 
# center longitude 
gmap = gmplot.GoogleMapPlotter(28.689169, 77.324448,17)
#set icon set Google marker icon
gmap.coloricon = "http://www.googlemapsmarkers.com/v1/%s/"

gmap.marker(lat,long,'yellow') #setting the marker of yellow color for start

 
Setting the marker for start as yellow color, last as red and others as blue color.

 Generate the HTML file that has the google map output of all data of route.csv file


gmap.draw("mymap.html")

---

=== Code ===

import csv
#check if module is available or not
#on python shell
#from gmplot import gmplot        
#if not available, install it
#pip3 install gmplot        

from gmplot import gmplot
gmap = gmplot.GoogleMapPlotter(28.689169, 77.324448,17)
gmap.coloricon = "http://www.googlemapsmarkers.com/v1/%s/"
        
with open("route.csv","r") as f:
    reader = csv.reader(f)
    k=0
    for row in reader:
        lat = float(row[0])
        long = float(row[1])
        #print(lat)
        #print(long)
        #print()
        if(k==0):
            gmap.marker(lat,long,'yellow')
            k=1
        else:
            gmap.marker
            (lat,long,'blue')
gmap.marker(lat,long,'red')            
gmap.draw("mymap.html")
#open the mymap.html file        



=== Output of mymap.html ===
Showing screen shot of html file.

== Snakes and Ladders By Ms.Ami Tusharkant Choksi == ==== Introduction ==== Snakes and ladders is a very popular game. Two or more players can play the game together. '''Board:''' The game is having board with numbers ranging from 1 to 100. Snakes and ladders are placed on the board in any direction, ranging from any number to any other number on the board.
'''Player:''' Each player has to roll a dice. Position of player, e.g. player1's cookie will be placed on new position, i.e. calculated from 
new position=current position + diceNumber
'''Snake or Ladder:''' There can be snake or ladder on the new position. If snake is there, user has to go down to the position of snake's tail. If ladder is there, user will reach to the position of top of the ladder. '''Win or loose:''' A player who reaches the number 100 on the board first, wins the game. === Explanation for the Code: === Vidyamam, in the lecture, taught us to create a board by loading the image on it. How players play and their position on the board is getting incremented by the dice generated number. She left the code for checking snake/ladder for us, that too i have implemented here, with a simple logic. --- ==== Show board ==== 
#show board image in a window
def show_board():
    img=Image.open('SNL.jpg')
    img.show()
--- [[File:SNL.jpg]] --- ==== Play ==== Explanation: Playing is, one by one, user will roll a dice. i.e. here we will generate random no. For that importing random is required. --- 
#play
def play():
    #input player names
    p1Name=input("Player1 Name : ")
    p2Name=input("Players Name : ")
    #initial points of players
    p1=0
    p2=0
    turn=0
    while(1):
        if(turn%2==0):
            print(p1Name, " Your turn")
            c = input("Press 1 to continue, 0 to exit : ")
            if(c==0):
                print(p1Name," Scored : ",p1)
                print(p2Name," Scored : ",p2)
                print("Quiting the game, bye")
                break
            #generate random number for dice
            dice = random.randint(1,6)
            print("Dice showed : ",dice)
            
            p1 = p1+dice
            p1 += check_snakeLadder()
            #after snake if, p1 becomes negative, make it 0,
            #as -ve is not available on board
            if(p1<0):
                p1=0
            
            if p1>end:
                p1=end
            print(p1Name, " Your Score : ",p1)
            if(reached_end(p1)):
                print(p1Name, " won")
                break
        else:
            print(p2Name, " Your turn")
            c = input("Press 1 to continue, 0 to exit : ")
            if(c==0):
                print(p1Name," Scored : ",p1)
                print(p2Name," Scored : ",p2)
                print("Quiting the game, bye")
                break
            #generate random number for dice
            dice = random.randint(1,6)
            print("Dice showed : ",dice)
            
            p2 = p2+dice
            p2 += check_snakeLadder() 
            #after snake if, p1 becomes negative, make it 0,
            #as -ve is not available on board
            if(p2<0):
                p2=0
            
            if p2>end:
                p2=end
            print(p2Name, " Your Score : ",p2)
            if(reached_end(p2)):
                print(p2Name, " won")
                break
        turn+=1
--- ==== Check for Snake or Ladder, End ==== A simple logic i have implemented here, which, mam left, for us to implement. When user rolls the dice, we will add new position to current position plus, number generated on dice. Now, we have to check whether,
  1. it is end or not, if it is end, the player wins.
    2. def reached_end(p):
    if(p>=end):
        return True
    return False
  2. it is snake, go down to the tail of snake
  3. it is ladder, to up to the top of ladder
    4. # a simple logic i have implemented here, which mam, left for us to implement
#check whether snake or ladder is there or not
def check_snakeLadder():
    snakeLadder = random.randint(2,80)
    divisor = random.randint(2,9)
    #if ladder is there, return +snakeLadder
    if(snakeLadder % divisor == 0):
        print("Wow Ladder : ", snakeLadder)
        return(snakeLadder)
    #if snake is there, return -snakeLadder
    elif(snakeLadder % divisor > 5):
        print("Sorry Snake : ",snakeLadder)
        return(-snakeLadder)
    #neither snake or ladder is there
    else:
        print("Neither snake nor ladder : ")
        return 0
==== Code ==== --- 
"""
Created on Tue Sep 11 11:59:28 2018
@author: amichoksi
"""
from PIL import Image
import random
end=100

#show board image in a window
def show_board():
    img=Image.open('SNL.jpg')
    img.show()
#check reach end
def reached_end(p):
    if(p>=end):
        return True
    return False
#check whether snake or ladder is there or not
def check_snakeLadder():
    snakeLadder = random.randint(2,80)
    divisor = random.randint(2,9)
    #if ladder is there, return +snakeLadder
    if(snakeLadder % divisor == 0):
        print("Wow Ladder : ", snakeLadder)
        return(snakeLadder)
    #if snake is there, return -snakeLadder
    elif(snakeLadder % divisor > 5):
        print("Sorry Snake : ",snakeLadder)
        return(-snakeLadder)
    #neither snake or ladder is there
    else:
        print("Neither snake nor ladder : ")
        return 0    
#play
def play():
    #input player names
    p1Name=input("Player1 Name : ")
    p2Name=input("Players Name : ")
    #initial points of players
    p1=0
    p2=0
    turn=0
    while(1):
        if(turn%2==0):
            print(p1Name, " Your turn")
            c = input("Press 1 to continue, 0 to exit : ")
            if(c==0):
                print(p1Name," Scored : ",p1)
                print(p2Name," Scored : ",p2)
                print("Quiting the game, bye")
                break
            #generate random number for dice
            dice = random.randint(1,6)
            print("Dice showed : ",dice)
            
            p1 = p1+dice
            p1 += check_snakeLadder()
            #after snake if, p1 becomes negative, make it 0,
            #as -ve is not available on board
            if(p1<0):
                p1=0
            
            if p1>end:
                p1=end
            print(p1Name, " Your Score : ",p1)
            if(reached_end(p1)):
                print(p1Name, " won")
                break
        else:
            print(p2Name, " Your turn")
            c = input("Press 1 to continue, 0 to exit : ")
            if(c==0):
                print(p1Name," Scored : ",p1)
                print(p2Name," Scored : ",p2)
                print("Quiting the game, bye")
                break
            #generate random number for dice
            dice = random.randint(1,6)
            print("Dice showed : ",dice)
            
            p2 = p2+dice
            p2 += check_snakeLadder() 
            #after snake if, p1 becomes negative, make it 0,
            #as -ve is not available on board
            if(p2<0):
                p2=0
            
            if p2>end:
                p2=end
            print(p2Name, " Your Score : ",p2)
            if(reached_end(p2)):
                print(p2Name, " won")
                break
        turn+=1
#calling the board and play methods
show_board()    
play()

== GPS Tracker By Ms.Ami Tusharkant Choksi ==
=== Introduction ===
We want to track a person. For that, GPS(Global Positioning System) tracker is useful. The output of GPS tracker is in the form of latitude and longitude. They are the real numbers, that we cannot understand easily. To make it understandable easily, if places of those locations with names as text and map is shown, humans can understand very easily. That's what we are implementing here. 
=== Explanation for Code ===
---
To implement GPS tracker in Python language, we need 

    

  • csv file, wherein latitude and longitude are available
    • 

  • gmplot python module should be install
    • 

  • generate HTML file, that contains the Google map output of all data of route.csv file

  • browser wherein we will see output
    • 


---

=== route.csv ===
route.csv file, as shared by Amitsir, is having data in the following format.

28.689519,77.324495
28.689431,77.324347
28.689316,77.324165
28.689285,77.324062
28.689218,77.323948
28.689343,77.323858
28.689431,77.323807


---

=== read csv file ===
Import the csv module and using the reader get values of longtitude and latitude from file.

import csv
reader = csv.reader(f)
    k=0
    for row in reader:
        lat = float(row[0])
        long = float(row[1])


=== Use of gmplot module ===
Check whether gmplot is installed or not on your system. For that on your python shell, write, 

from gmplot import gmplot


If it, gives any error, it means, gmplot module is not installed on your machine. One can install gmplot using

pip3 install gmplot


on Ubuntu or linux compatible machines. The required code for generating HTML file, from google map is as follows:


# import gmplot package 
import gmplot 
  
# GoogleMapPlotter return Map object 
# Pass the center latitude and 
# center longitude 
gmap = gmplot.GoogleMapPlotter(28.689169, 77.324448,17)
#set icon set Google marker icon
gmap.coloricon = "http://www.googlemapsmarkers.com/v1/%s/"

gmap.marker(lat,long,'yellow') #setting the marker of yellow color for start

 
Setting the marker for start as yellow color, last as red and others as blue color.

 Generate the HTML file that has the google map output of all data of route.csv file


gmap.draw("mymap.html")

---

=== Code ===

import csv
#check if module is available or not
#on python shell
#from gmplot import gmplot        
#if not available, install it
#pip3 install gmplot        

from gmplot import gmplot
gmap = gmplot.GoogleMapPlotter(28.689169, 77.324448,17)
gmap.coloricon = "http://www.googlemapsmarkers.com/v1/%s/"
        
with open("route.csv","r") as f:
    reader = csv.reader(f)
    k=0
    for row in reader:
        lat = float(row[0])
        long = float(row[1])
        #print(lat)
        #print(long)
        #print()
        if(k==0):
            gmap.marker(lat,long,'yellow')
            k=1
        else:
            gmap.marker
            (lat,long,'blue')
gmap.marker(lat,long,'red')            
gmap.draw("mymap.html")
#open the mymap.html file

== Snakes and Ladders By Ms.Ami Tusharkant Choksi == ==== Introduction ==== Snakes and ladders is a very popular game. Two or more players can play the game together. '''Board:''' The game is having board with numbers ranging from 1 to 100. Snakes and ladders are placed on the board in any direction, ranging from any number to any other number on the board.
'''Player:''' Each player has to roll a dice. Position of player, e.g. player1's cookie will be placed on new position, i.e. calculated from 
new position=current position + diceNumber
'''Snake or Ladder:''' There can be snake or ladder on the new position. If snake is there, user has to go down to the position of snake's tail. If ladder is there, user will reach to the position of top of the ladder. '''Win or loose:''' A player who reaches the number 100 on the board first, wins the game. === Explanation for the Code: === Vidyamam, in the lecture, taught us to create a board by loading the image on it. How players play and their position on the board is getting incremented by the dice generated number. She left the code for checking snake/ladder for us, that too i have implemented here, with a simple logic. --- ==== Show board ==== 
#show board image in a window
def show_board():
    img=Image.open('SNL.jpg')
    img.show()
--- [[File:SNL.jpg]] --- ==== Play ==== Explanation: Playing is, one by one, user will roll a dice. i.e. here we will generate random no. For that importing random is required. --- 
#play
def play():
    #input player names
    p1Name=input("Player1 Name : ")
    p2Name=input("Players Name : ")
    #initial points of players
    p1=0
    p2=0
    turn=0
    while(1):
        if(turn%2==0):
            print(p1Name, " Your turn")
            c = input("Press 1 to continue, 0 to exit : ")
            if(c==0):
                print(p1Name," Scored : ",p1)
                print(p2Name," Scored : ",p2)
                print("Quiting the game, bye")
                break
            #generate random number for dice
            dice = random.randint(1,6)
            print("Dice showed : ",dice)
            
            p1 = p1+dice
            p1 += check_snakeLadder()
            #after snake if, p1 becomes negative, make it 0,
            #as -ve is not available on board
            if(p1<0):
                p1=0
            
            if p1>end:
                p1=end
            print(p1Name, " Your Score : ",p1)
            if(reached_end(p1)):
                print(p1Name, " won")
                break
        else:
            print(p2Name, " Your turn")
            c = input("Press 1 to continue, 0 to exit : ")
            if(c==0):
                print(p1Name," Scored : ",p1)
                print(p2Name," Scored : ",p2)
                print("Quiting the game, bye")
                break
            #generate random number for dice
            dice = random.randint(1,6)
            print("Dice showed : ",dice)
            
            p2 = p2+dice
            p2 += check_snakeLadder() 
            #after snake if, p1 becomes negative, make it 0,
            #as -ve is not available on board
            if(p2<0):
                p2=0
            
            if p2>end:
                p2=end
            print(p2Name, " Your Score : ",p2)
            if(reached_end(p2)):
                print(p2Name, " won")
                break
        turn+=1
--- ==== Check for Snake or Ladder, End ==== A simple logic i have implemented here, which, mam left, for us to implement. When user rolls the dice, we will add new position to current position plus, number generated on dice. Now, we have to check whether,
  1. it is end or not, if it is end, the player wins.
    2. def reached_end(p):
    if(p>=end):
        return True
    return False
  2. it is snake, go down to the tail of snake
  3. it is ladder, to up to the top of ladder
    4. # a simple logic i have implemented here, which mam, left for us to implement
#check whether snake or ladder is there or not
def check_snakeLadder():
    snakeLadder = random.randint(2,80)
    divisor = random.randint(2,9)
    #if ladder is there, return +snakeLadder
    if(snakeLadder % divisor == 0):
        print("Wow Ladder : ", snakeLadder)
        return(snakeLadder)
    #if snake is there, return -snakeLadder
    elif(snakeLadder % divisor > 5):
        print("Sorry Snake : ",snakeLadder)
        return(-snakeLadder)
    #neither snake or ladder is there
    else:
        print("Neither snake nor ladder : ")
        return 0
==== Code ==== --- 
"""
Created on Tue Sep 11 11:59:28 2018
@author: amichoksi
"""
from PIL import Image
import random
end=100

#show board image in a window
def show_board():
    img=Image.open('SNL.jpg')
    img.show()
#check reach end
def reached_end(p):
    if(p>=end):
        return True
    return False
#check whether snake or ladder is there or not
def check_snakeLadder():
    snakeLadder = random.randint(2,80)
    divisor = random.randint(2,9)
    #if ladder is there, return +snakeLadder
    if(snakeLadder % divisor == 0):
        print("Wow Ladder : ", snakeLadder)
        return(snakeLadder)
    #if snake is there, return -snakeLadder
    elif(snakeLadder % divisor > 5):
        print("Sorry Snake : ",snakeLadder)
        return(-snakeLadder)
    #neither snake or ladder is there
    else:
        print("Neither snake nor ladder : ")
        return 0    
#play
def play():
    #input player names
    p1Name=input("Player1 Name : ")
    p2Name=input("Players Name : ")
    #initial points of players
    p1=0
    p2=0
    turn=0
    while(1):
        if(turn%2==0):
            print(p1Name, " Your turn")
            c = input("Press 1 to continue, 0 to exit : ")
            if(c==0):
                print(p1Name," Scored : ",p1)
                print(p2Name," Scored : ",p2)
                print("Quiting the game, bye")
                break
            #generate random number for dice
            dice = random.randint(1,6)
            print("Dice showed : ",dice)
            
            p1 = p1+dice
            p1 += check_snakeLadder()
            #after snake if, p1 becomes negative, make it 0,
            #as -ve is not available on board
            if(p1<0):
                p1=0
            
            if p1>end:
                p1=end
            print(p1Name, " Your Score : ",p1)
            if(reached_end(p1)):
                print(p1Name, " won")
                break
        else:
            print(p2Name, " Your turn")
            c = input("Press 1 to continue, 0 to exit : ")
            if(c==0):
                print(p1Name," Scored : ",p1)
                print(p2Name," Scored : ",p2)
                print("Quiting the game, bye")
                break
            #generate random number for dice
            dice = random.randint(1,6)
            print("Dice showed : ",dice)
            
            p2 = p2+dice
            p2 += check_snakeLadder() 
            #after snake if, p1 becomes negative, make it 0,
            #as -ve is not available on board
            if(p2<0):
                p2=0
            
            if p2>end:
                p2=end
            print(p2Name, " Your Score : ",p2)
            if(reached_end(p2)):
                print(p2Name, " won")
                break
        turn+=1
#calling the board and play methods
show_board()    
play()

== GPS Tracker By Ms.Ami Tusharkant Choksi ==
=== Introduction ===
We want to track a person. For that, GPS(Global Positioning System) tracker is useful. The output of GPS tracker is in the form of latitude and longitude. They are the real numbers, that we cannot understand easily. To make it understandable easily, if places of those locations with names as text and map is shown, humans can understand very easily. That's what we are implementing here. 
=== Explanation for Code ===
---
To implement GPS tracker in Python language, we need 

    

  • csv file, wherein latitude and longitude are available
    • 

  • gmplot python module should be install
    • 

  • generate HTML file, that contains the Google map output of all data of route.csv file

  • browser wherein we will see output
    • 


---

=== route.csv ===
route.csv file, as shared by Amitsir, is having data in the following format.

28.689519,77.324495
28.689431,77.324347
28.689316,77.324165
28.689285,77.324062
28.689218,77.323948
28.689343,77.323858
28.689431,77.323807

=== Use of gmplot module ===
Check whether gmplot is installed or not on your system. For that on your python shell, write, 

from gmplot import gmplot


If it, gives any error, it means, gmplot module is not installed on your machine. One can install gmplot using

pip3 install gmplot


on Ubuntu or linux compatible machines. The required code for generating HTML file, from google map is as follows:


# import gmplot package 
import gmplot 
  
# GoogleMapPlotter return Map object 
# Pass the center latitude and 
# center longitude 
gmap = gmplot.GoogleMapPlotter(28.689169, 77.324448,17)
#set icon set Google marker icon
gmap.coloricon = "http://www.googlemapsmarkers.com/v1/%s/"

gmap.marker(lat,long,'yellow') #setting the marker of yellow color for start

 
Setting the marker for start as yellow color, last as red and others as blue color.

 Generate the HTML file that has the google map output of all data of route.csv file


gmap.draw("mymap.html")

---

=== Code ===

import csv
#check if module is available or not
#on python shell
#from gmplot import gmplot        
#if not available, install it
#pip3 install gmplot        

from gmplot import gmplot
gmap = gmplot.GoogleMapPlotter(28.689169, 77.324448,17)
gmap.coloricon = "http://www.googlemapsmarkers.com/v1/%s/"
        
with open("route.csv","r") as f:
    reader = csv.reader(f)
    k=0
    for row in reader:
        lat = float(row[0])
        long = float(row[1])
        #print(lat)
        #print(long)
        #print()
        if(k==0):
            gmap.marker(lat,long,'yellow')
            k=1
        else:
            gmap.marker
            (lat,long,'blue')
gmap.marker(lat,long,'red')            
gmap.draw("mymap.html")
#open the mymap.html file

== Snakes and Ladders By Ms.Ami Tusharkant Choksi == ==== Introduction ==== Snakes and ladders is a very popular game. Two or more players can play the game together. '''Board:''' The game is having board with numbers ranging from 1 to 100. Snakes and ladders are placed on the board in any direction, ranging from any number to any other number on the board.
'''Player:''' Each player has to roll a dice. Position of player, e.g. player1's cookie will be placed on new position, i.e. calculated from 
new position=current position + diceNumber
'''Snake or Ladder:''' There can be snake or ladder on the new position. If snake is there, user has to go down to the position of snake's tail. If ladder is there, user will reach to the position of top of the ladder. '''Win or loose:''' A player who reaches the number 100 on the board first, wins the game. === Explanation for the Code: === Vidyamam, in the lecture, taught us to create a board by loading the image on it. How players play and their position on the board is getting incremented by the dice generated number. She left the code for checking snake/ladder for us, that too i have implemented here, with a simple logic. --- ==== Show board ==== 
#show board image in a window
def show_board():
    img=Image.open('SNL.jpg')
    img.show()
--- [[File:SNL.jpg]] --- ==== Play ==== Explanation: Playing is, one by one, user will roll a dice. i.e. here we will generate random no. For that importing random is required. --- 
#play
def play():
    #input player names
    p1Name=input("Player1 Name : ")
    p2Name=input("Players Name : ")
    #initial points of players
    p1=0
    p2=0
    turn=0
    while(1):
        if(turn%2==0):
            print(p1Name, " Your turn")
            c = input("Press 1 to continue, 0 to exit : ")
            if(c==0):
                print(p1Name," Scored : ",p1)
                print(p2Name," Scored : ",p2)
                print("Quiting the game, bye")
                break
            #generate random number for dice
            dice = random.randint(1,6)
            print("Dice showed : ",dice)
            
            p1 = p1+dice
            p1 += check_snakeLadder()
            #after snake if, p1 becomes negative, make it 0,
            #as -ve is not available on board
            if(p1<0):
                p1=0
            
            if p1>end:
                p1=end
            print(p1Name, " Your Score : ",p1)
            if(reached_end(p1)):
                print(p1Name, " won")
                break
        else:
            print(p2Name, " Your turn")
            c = input("Press 1 to continue, 0 to exit : ")
            if(c==0):
                print(p1Name," Scored : ",p1)
                print(p2Name," Scored : ",p2)
                print("Quiting the game, bye")
                break
            #generate random number for dice
            dice = random.randint(1,6)
            print("Dice showed : ",dice)
            
            p2 = p2+dice
            p2 += check_snakeLadder() 
            #after snake if, p1 becomes negative, make it 0,
            #as -ve is not available on board
            if(p2<0):
                p2=0
            
            if p2>end:
                p2=end
            print(p2Name, " Your Score : ",p2)
            if(reached_end(p2)):
                print(p2Name, " won")
                break
        turn+=1
--- ==== Check for Snake or Ladder, End ==== A simple logic i have implemented here, which, mam left, for us to implement. When user rolls the dice, we will add new position to current position plus, number generated on dice. Now, we have to check whether,
  1. it is end or not, if it is end, the player wins.
    2. def reached_end(p):
    if(p>=end):
        return True
    return False
  2. it is snake, go down to the tail of snake
  3. it is ladder, to up to the top of ladder
    4. # a simple logic i have implemented here, which mam, left for us to implement
#check whether snake or ladder is there or not
def check_snakeLadder():
    snakeLadder = random.randint(2,80)
    divisor = random.randint(2,9)
    #if ladder is there, return +snakeLadder
    if(snakeLadder % divisor == 0):
        print("Wow Ladder : ", snakeLadder)
        return(snakeLadder)
    #if snake is there, return -snakeLadder
    elif(snakeLadder % divisor > 5):
        print("Sorry Snake : ",snakeLadder)
        return(-snakeLadder)
    #neither snake or ladder is there
    else:
        print("Neither snake nor ladder : ")
        return 0

"""
Created on Tue Sep 11 11:59:28 2018

from PIL import Image
import random
end=100

#show board image in a window
def show_board():
    img=Image.open('SNL.jpg')
    img.show()
#check reach end
def reached_end(p):
    if(p>=end):
        return True
    return False
#check whether snake or ladder is there or not
def check_snakeLadder():
    snakeLadder = random.randint(2,80)
    divisor = random.randint(2,9)
    #if ladder is there, return +snakeLadder
    if(snakeLadder % divisor == 0):
        print("Wow Ladder : ", snakeLadder)
        return(snakeLadder)
    #if snake is there, return -snakeLadder
    elif(snakeLadder % divisor > 5):
        print("Sorry Snake : ",snakeLadder)
        return(-snakeLadder)
    #neither snake or ladder is there
    else:
        print("Neither snake nor ladder : ")
        return 0    
#play
def play():
    #input player names
    p1Name=input("Player1 Name : ")
    p2Name=input("Players Name : ")
    #initial points of players
    p1=0
    p2=0
    turn=0
    while(1):
        if(turn%2==0):
            print(p1Name, " Your turn")
            c = input("Press 1 to continue, 0 to exit : ")
            if(c==0):
                print(p1Name," Scored : ",p1)
                print(p2Name," Scored : ",p2)
                print("Quiting the game, bye")
                break
            #generate random number for dice
            dice = random.randint(1,6)
            print("Dice showed : ",dice)
            
            p1 = p1+dice
            p1 += check_snakeLadder()
            #after snake if, p1 becomes negative, make it 0,
            #as -ve is not available on board
            if(p1<0):
                p1=0
            
            if p1>end:
                p1=end
            print(p1Name, " Your Score : ",p1)
            if(reached_end(p1)):
                print(p1Name, " won")
                break
        else:
            print(p2Name, " Your turn")
            c = input("Press 1 to continue, 0 to exit : ")
            if(c==0):
                print(p1Name," Scored : ",p1)
                print(p2Name," Scored : ",p2)
                print("Quiting the game, bye")
                break
            #generate random number for dice
            dice = random.randint(1,6)
            print("Dice showed : ",dice)
            
            p2 = p2+dice
            p2 += check_snakeLadder() 
            #after snake if, p1 becomes negative, make it 0,
            #as -ve is not available on board
            if(p2<0):
                p2=0
            
            if p2>end:
                p2=end
            print(p2Name, " Your Score : ",p2)
            if(reached_end(p2)):
                print(p2Name, " won")
                break
        turn+=1
#calling the board and play methods
show_board()    
play()

=== Use of gmplot module ===
Check whether gmplot is installed or not on your system. For that on your python shell, write, 

from gmplot import gmplot


If it, gives any error, it means, gmplot module is not installed on your machine. One can install gmplot using

pip3 install gmplot


on Ubuntu or linux compatible machines. The required code for generating HTML file, from google map is as follows:


# import gmplot package 
import gmplot 
  
# GoogleMapPlotter return Map object 
# Pass the center latitude and 
# center longitude 
gmap = gmplot.GoogleMapPlotter(28.689169, 77.324448,17)
#set icon set Google marker icon

gmap.marker(lat,long,'yellow') #setting the marker of yellow color for start

import csv
#check if module is available or not
#on python shell
#from gmplot import gmplot        
#if not available, install it
#pip3 install gmplot        

from gmplot import gmplot
gmap = gmplot.GoogleMapPlotter(28.689169, 77.324448,17)
gmap.coloricon = "http://www.googlemapsmarkers.com/v1/%s/"
        
with open("route.csv","r") as f:
    reader = csv.reader(f)
    k=0
    for row in reader:
        lat = float(row[0])
        long = float(row[1])
        #print(lat)
        #print(long)
        #print()
        if(k==0):
            gmap.marker(lat,long,'yellow')
            k=1
        else:
            gmap.marker
            (lat,long,'blue')
gmap.marker(lat,long,'red')            
gmap.draw("mymap.html")
#open the mymap.html file

== Snakes and Ladders By Ms.Ami Tusharkant Choksi == ==== Introduction ==== Snakes and ladders is a very popular game. Two or more players can play the game together. '''Board:''' The game is having board with numbers ranging from 1 to 100. Snakes and ladders are placed on the board in any direction, ranging from any number to any other number on the board.
'''Player:''' Each player has to roll a dice. Position of player, e.g. player1's cookie will be placed on new position, i.e. calculated from 
new position=current position + diceNumber
'''Snake or Ladder:''' There can be snake or ladder on the new position. If snake is there, user has to go down to the position of snake's tail. If ladder is there, user will reach to the position of top of the ladder. '''Win or loose:''' A player who reaches the number 100 on the board first, wins the game. === Explanation for the Code: === Vidyamam, in the lecture, taught us to create a board by loading the image on it. How players play and their position on the board is getting incremented by the dice generated number. She left the code for checking snake/ladder for us, that too i have implemented here, with a simple logic. --- ==== Show board ==== 
#show board image in a window
def show_board():
    img=Image.open('SNL.jpg')
    img.show()
--- [[File:SNL.jpg]] --- ==== Play ==== Explanation: Playing is, one by one, user will roll a dice. i.e. here we will generate random no. For that importing random is required. --- 
#play
def play():
    #input player names
    p1Name=input("Player1 Name : ")
    p2Name=input("Players Name : ")
    #initial points of players
    p1=0
    p2=0
    turn=0
    while(1):
        if(turn%2==0):
            print(p1Name, " Your turn")
            c = input("Press 1 to continue, 0 to exit : ")
            if(c==0):
                print(p1Name," Scored : ",p1)
                print(p2Name," Scored : ",p2)
                print("Quiting the game, bye")
                break
            #generate random number for dice
            dice = random.randint(1,6)
            print("Dice showed : ",dice)
            
            p1 = p1+dice
            p1 += check_snakeLadder()
            #after snake if, p1 becomes negative, make it 0,
            #as -ve is not available on board
            if(p1<0):
                p1=0
            
            if p1>end:
                p1=end
            print(p1Name, " Your Score : ",p1)
            if(reached_end(p1)):
                print(p1Name, " won")
                break
        else:
            print(p2Name, " Your turn")
            c = input("Press 1 to continue, 0 to exit : ")
            if(c==0):
                print(p1Name," Scored : ",p1)
                print(p2Name," Scored : ",p2)
                print("Quiting the game, bye")
                break
            #generate random number for dice
            dice = random.randint(1,6)
            print("Dice showed : ",dice)
            
            p2 = p2+dice
            p2 += check_snakeLadder() 
            #after snake if, p1 becomes negative, make it 0,
            #as -ve is not available on board
            if(p2<0):
                p2=0
            
            if p2>end:
                p2=end
            print(p2Name, " Your Score : ",p2)
            if(reached_end(p2)):
                print(p2Name, " won")
                break
        turn+=1
--- ==== Check for Snake or Ladder, End ==== A simple logic i have implemented here, which, mam left, for us to implement. When user rolls the dice, we will add new position to current position plus, number generated on dice. Now, we have to check whether,
  1. it is end or not, if it is end, the player wins.
    2. def reached_end(p):
    if(p>=end):
        return True
    return False
  2. it is snake, go down to the tail of snake
  3. it is ladder, to up to the top of ladder

#check whether snake or ladder is there or not
def check_snakeLadder():
    snakeLadder = random.randint(2,80)
    divisor = random.randint(2,9)
    #if ladder is there, return +snakeLadder
    if(snakeLadder % divisor == 0):
        print("Wow Ladder : ", snakeLadder)
        return(snakeLadder)
    #if snake is there, return -snakeLadder
    elif(snakeLadder % divisor > 5):
        print("Sorry Snake : ",snakeLadder)
        return(-snakeLadder)
    #neither snake or ladder is there
    else:
        print("Neither snake nor ladder : ")
        return 0

"""
Created on Tue Sep 11 11:59:28 2018
@author: amichoksi
"""
from PIL import Image
import random
end=100

#show board image in a window
def show_board():
    img=Image.open('SNL.jpg')
    img.show()
#check reach end
def reached_end(p):
    if(p>=end):
        return True
    return False
#check whether snake or ladder is there or not
def check_snakeLadder():
    snakeLadder = random.randint(2,80)
    divisor = random.randint(2,9)
    #if ladder is there, return +snakeLadder
    if(snakeLadder % divisor == 0):
        print("Wow Ladder : ", snakeLadder)
        return(snakeLadder)
    #if snake is there, return -snakeLadder
    elif(snakeLadder % divisor > 5):
        print("Sorry Snake : ",snakeLadder)
        return(-snakeLadder)
    #neither snake or ladder is there
    else:
        print("Neither snake nor ladder : ")
        return 0    
#play
def play():
    #input player names
    p1Name=input("Player1 Name : ")
    p2Name=input("Players Name : ")
    #initial points of players
    p1=0
    p2=0
    turn=0
    while(1):
        if(turn%2==0):
            print(p1Name, " Your turn")
            c = input("Press 1 to continue, 0 to exit : ")
            if(c==0):
                print(p1Name," Scored : ",p1)
                print(p2Name," Scored : ",p2)
                print("Quiting the game, bye")
                break
            #generate random number for dice
            dice = random.randint(1,6)
            print("Dice showed : ",dice)
            
            p1 = p1+dice
            p1 += check_snakeLadder()
            #after snake if, p1 becomes negative, make it 0,
            #as -ve is not available on board
            if(p1<0):
                p1=0
            
            if p1>end:
                p1=end
            print(p1Name, " Your Score : ",p1)
            if(reached_end(p1)):
                print(p1Name, " won")
                break
        else:
            print(p2Name, " Your turn")
            c = input("Press 1 to continue, 0 to exit : ")
            if(c==0):
                print(p1Name," Scored : ",p1)
                print(p2Name," Scored : ",p2)
                print("Quiting the game, bye")
                break
            #generate random number for dice
            dice = random.randint(1,6)
            print("Dice showed : ",dice)
            
            p2 = p2+dice
            p2 += check_snakeLadder() 
            #after snake if, p1 becomes negative, make it 0,
            #as -ve is not available on board
            if(p2<0):
                p2=0
            
            if p2>end:
                p2=end
            print(p2Name, " Your Score : ",p2)
            if(reached_end(p2)):
                print(p2Name, " won")
                break
        turn+=1
#calling the board and play methods
show_board()    
play()

== GPS Tracker By Ms.Ami Tusharkant Choksi ==
=== Introduction ===
We want to track a person. For that, GPS(Global Positioning System) tracker is useful. The output of GPS tracker is in the form of latitude and longitude. They are the real numbers, that we cannot understand easily. To make it understandable easily, if places of those locations with names as text and map is shown, humans can understand very easily. That's what we are implementing here. 
=== Explanation for Code ===
---
To implement GPS tracker in Python language, we need 

    

  • csv file, wherein latitude and longitude are available
    • 

  • gmplot python module should be install
    • 

  • generate HTML file, that contains the Google map output of all data of route.csv file

  • browser wherein we will see output
    •

=== Use of gmplot module ===
Check whether gmplot is installed or not on your system. For that on your python shell, write, 

from gmplot import gmplot


If it, gives any error, it means, gmplot module is not installed on your machine. One can install gmplot using

pip3 install gmplot


on Ubuntu or linux compatible machines. The required code for generating HTML file, from google map is as follows:


# import gmplot package 
import gmplot 
  
# GoogleMapPlotter return Map object 
# Pass the center latitude and 
# center longitude 
gmap = gmplot.GoogleMapPlotter(28.689169, 77.324448,17)
#set icon set Google marker icon
gmap.coloricon = "http://www.googlemapsmarkers.com/v1/%s/"

gmap.marker(lat,long,'yellow') #setting the marker of yellow color for start

 
Setting the marker for start as yellow color, last as red and others as blue color.

 Generate the HTML file that has the google map output of all data of route.csv file


gmap.draw("mymap.html")

---

=== Code ===

import csv
#check if module is available or not
#on python shell
#from gmplot import gmplot        
#if not available, install it
#pip3 install gmplot        

from gmplot import gmplot
gmap = gmplot.GoogleMapPlotter(28.689169, 77.324448,17)
gmap.coloricon = "http://www.googlemapsmarkers.com/v1/%s/"
        
with open("route.csv","r") as f:
    reader = csv.reader(f)
    k=0
    for row in reader:
        lat = float(row[0])
        long = float(row[1])
        #print(lat)
        #print(long)
        #print()
        if(k==0):
            gmap.marker(lat,long,'yellow')
            k=1
        else:
            gmap.marker
            (lat,long,'blue')
gmap.marker(lat,long,'red')            
gmap.draw("mymap.html")
#open the mymap.html file

== Snakes and Ladders By Ms.Ami Tusharkant Choksi == ==== Introduction ==== Snakes and ladders is a very popular game. Two or more players can play the game together. '''Board:''' The game is having board with numbers ranging from 1 to 100. Snakes and ladders are placed on the board in any direction, ranging from any number to any other number on the board.
'''Player:''' Each player has to roll a dice. Position of player, e.g. player1's cookie will be placed on new position, i.e. calculated from 
new position=current position + diceNumber
'''Snake or Ladder:''' There can be snake or ladder on the new position. If snake is there, user has to go down to the position of snake's tail. If ladder is there, user will reach to the position of top of the ladder. '''Win or loose:''' A player who reaches the number 100 on the board first, wins the game. === Explanation for the Code: === Vidyamam, in the lecture, taught us to create a board by loading the image on it. How players play and their position on the board is getting incremented by the dice generated number. She left the code for checking snake/ladder for us, that too i have implemented here, with a simple logic. --- ==== Show board ==== 
#show board image in a window
def show_board():
    img=Image.open('SNL.jpg')
    img.show()
--- [[File:SNL.jpg]] --- ==== Play ==== Explanation: Playing is, one by one, user will roll a dice. i.e. here we will generate random no. For that importing random is required. --- 
#play
def play():
    #input player names
    p1Name=input("Player1 Name : ")
    p2Name=input("Players Name : ")
    #initial points of players
    p1=0
    p2=0
    turn=0
    while(1):
        if(turn%2==0):
            print(p1Name, " Your turn")
            c = input("Press 1 to continue, 0 to exit : ")
            if(c==0):
                print(p1Name," Scored : ",p1)
                print(p2Name," Scored : ",p2)
                print("Quiting the game, bye")
                break
            #generate random number for dice
            dice = random.randint(1,6)
            print("Dice showed : ",dice)
            
            p1 = p1+dice
            p1 += check_snakeLadder()
            #after snake if, p1 becomes negative, make it 0,
            #as -ve is not available on board
            if(p1<0):
                p1=0
            
            if p1>end:
                p1=end
            print(p1Name, " Your Score : ",p1)
            if(reached_end(p1)):
                print(p1Name, " won")
                break
        else:
            print(p2Name, " Your turn")
            c = input("Press 1 to continue, 0 to exit : ")
            if(c==0):
                print(p1Name," Scored : ",p1)
                print(p2Name," Scored : ",p2)
                print("Quiting the game, bye")
                break
            #generate random number for dice
            dice = random.randint(1,6)
            print("Dice showed : ",dice)
            
            p2 = p2+dice
            p2 += check_snakeLadder() 
            #after snake if, p1 becomes negative, make it 0,
            #as -ve is not available on board
            if(p2<0):
                p2=0
            
            if p2>end:
                p2=end
            print(p2Name, " Your Score : ",p2)
            if(reached_end(p2)):
                print(p2Name, " won")
                break
        turn+=1
--- ==== Check for Snake or Ladder, End ==== A simple logic i have implemented here, which, mam left, for us to implement. When user rolls the dice, we will add new position to current position plus, number generated on dice. Now, we have to check whether,
  1. it is end or not, if it is end, the player wins.
    2. def reached_end(p):
    if(p>=end):
        return True
    return False
  2. it is snake, go down to the tail of snake
  3. it is ladder, to up to the top of ladder
    4. # a simple logic i have implemented here, which mam, left for us to implement
#check whether snake or ladder is there or not
def check_snakeLadder():
    snakeLadder = random.randint(2,80)
    divisor = random.randint(2,9)
    #if ladder is there, return +snakeLadder
    if(snakeLadder % divisor == 0):
        print("Wow Ladder : ", snakeLadder)
        return(snakeLadder)
    #if snake is there, return -snakeLadder
    elif(snakeLadder % divisor > 5):
        print("Sorry Snake : ",snakeLadder)
        return(-snakeLadder)
    #neither snake or ladder is there
    else:
        print("Neither snake nor ladder : ")
        return 0
==== Code ==== --- 
"""
Created on Tue Sep 11 11:59:28 2018
@author: amichoksi
"""
from PIL import Image
import random
end=100

#show board image in a window
def show_board():
    img=Image.open('SNL.jpg')
    img.show()
#check reach end
def reached_end(p):
    if(p>=end):
        return True
    return False
#check whether snake or ladder is there or not
def check_snakeLadder():
    snakeLadder = random.randint(2,80)
    divisor = random.randint(2,9)
    #if ladder is there, return +snakeLadder
    if(snakeLadder % divisor == 0):
        print("Wow Ladder : ", snakeLadder)
        return(snakeLadder)
    #if snake is there, return -snakeLadder
    elif(snakeLadder % divisor > 5):
        print("Sorry Snake : ",snakeLadder)
        return(-snakeLadder)
    #neither snake or ladder is there
    else:
        print("Neither snake nor ladder : ")
        return 0    
#play
def play():
    #input player names
    p1Name=input("Player1 Name : ")
    p2Name=input("Players Name : ")
    #initial points of players
    p1=0
    p2=0
    turn=0
    while(1):
        if(turn%2==0):
            print(p1Name, " Your turn")
            c = input("Press 1 to continue, 0 to exit : ")
            if(c==0):
                print(p1Name," Scored : ",p1)
                print(p2Name," Scored : ",p2)
                print("Quiting the game, bye")
                break
            #generate random number for dice
            dice = random.randint(1,6)
            print("Dice showed : ",dice)
            
            p1 = p1+dice
            p1 += check_snakeLadder()
            #after snake if, p1 becomes negative, make it 0,
            #as -ve is not available on board
            if(p1<0):
                p1=0
            
            if p1>end:
                p1=end
            print(p1Name, " Your Score : ",p1)
            if(reached_end(p1)):
                print(p1Name, " won")
                break
        else:
            print(p2Name, " Your turn")
            c = input("Press 1 to continue, 0 to exit : ")
            if(c==0):
                print(p1Name," Scored : ",p1)
                print(p2Name," Scored : ",p2)
                print("Quiting the game, bye")
                break
            #generate random number for dice
            dice = random.randint(1,6)
            print("Dice showed : ",dice)
            
            p2 = p2+dice
            p2 += check_snakeLadder() 
            #after snake if, p1 becomes negative, make it 0,
            #as -ve is not available on board
            if(p2<0):
                p2=0
            
            if p2>end:
                p2=end
            print(p2Name, " Your Score : ",p2)
            if(reached_end(p2)):
                print(p2Name, " won")
                break
        turn+=1
#calling the board and play methods
show_board()    
play()

== GPS Tracker By Ms.Ami Tusharkant Choksi ==
=== Introduction ===
We want to track a person. For that, GPS(Global Positioning System) tracker is useful. The output of GPS tracker is in the form of latitude and longitude. They are the real numbers, that we cannot understand easily. To make it understandable easily, if places of those locations with names as text and map is shown, humans can understand very easily. That's what we are implementing here. 
=== Explanation for Code ===
---
To implement GPS tracker in Python language, we need 

    

  • csv file, wherein latitude and longitude are available
    • 

  • gmplot python module should be install
    • 

  • generate HTML file, that contains the Google map output of all data of route.csv file

  • browser wherein we will see output
    • 


---

28.689218,77.323948
28.689343,77.323858
28.689431,77.323807

    for row in reader:

        long = float(row[1])

=== Use of gmplot module ===
Check whether gmplot is installed or not on your system. For that on your python shell, write, 

from gmplot import gmplot


If it, gives any error, it means, gmplot module is not installed on your machine. One can install gmplot using

pip3 install gmplot


on Ubuntu or linux compatible machines. The required code for generating HTML file, from google map is as follows:


# import gmplot package 
import gmplot 
  
# GoogleMapPlotter return Map object 
# Pass the center latitude and 
# center longitude 
gmap = gmplot.GoogleMapPlotter(28.689169, 77.324448,17)
#set icon set Google marker icon
gmap.coloricon = "http://www.googlemapsmarkers.com/v1/%s/"

gmap.marker(lat,long,'yellow') #setting the marker of yellow color for start

 
Setting the marker for start as yellow color, last as red and others as blue color.

 Generate the HTML file that has the google map output of all data of route.csv file


gmap.draw("mymap.html")

---

=== Code ===

import csv
#check if module is available or not
#on python shell
#from gmplot import gmplot        
#if not available, install it
#pip3 install gmplot        

from gmplot import gmplot
gmap = gmplot.GoogleMapPlotter(28.689169, 77.324448,17)
gmap.coloricon = "http://www.googlemapsmarkers.com/v1/%s/"
        
with open("route.csv","r") as f:
    reader = csv.reader(f)
    k=0
    for row in reader:
        lat = float(row[0])
        long = float(row[1])
        #print(lat)
        #print(long)
        #print()
        if(k==0):
            gmap.marker(lat,long,'yellow')
            k=1
        else:
            gmap.marker
            (lat,long,'blue')
gmap.marker(lat,long,'red')            
gmap.draw("mymap.html")
#open the mymap.html file

== Snakes and Ladders By Ms.Ami Tusharkant Choksi == ==== Introduction ==== Snakes and ladders is a very popular game. Two or more players can play the game together. '''Board:''' The game is having board with numbers ranging from 1 to 100. Snakes and ladders are placed on the board in any direction, ranging from any number to any other number on the board.
'''Player:''' Each player has to roll a dice. Position of player, e.g. player1's cookie will be placed on new position, i.e. calculated from 
new position=current position + diceNumber
'''Snake or Ladder:''' There can be snake or ladder on the new position. If snake is there, user has to go down to the position of snake's tail. If ladder is there, user will reach to the position of top of the ladder. '''Win or loose:''' A player who reaches the number 100 on the board first, wins the game. === Explanation for the Code: === Vidyamam, in the lecture, taught us to create a board by loading the image on it. How players play and their position on the board is getting incremented by the dice generated number. She left the code for checking snake/ladder for us, that too i have implemented here, with a simple logic. --- ==== Show board ==== 
#show board image in a window
def show_board():
    img=Image.open('SNL.jpg')
    img.show()
--- [[File:SNL.jpg]] --- ==== Play ==== Explanation: Playing is, one by one, user will roll a dice. i.e. here we will generate random no. For that importing random is required. --- 
#play
def play():
    #input player names
    p1Name=input("Player1 Name : ")
    p2Name=input("Players Name : ")
    #initial points of players
    p1=0
    p2=0
    turn=0
    while(1):
        if(turn%2==0):
            print(p1Name, " Your turn")
            c = input("Press 1 to continue, 0 to exit : ")
            if(c==0):
                print(p1Name," Scored : ",p1)
                print(p2Name," Scored : ",p2)
                print("Quiting the game, bye")
                break
            #generate random number for dice
            dice = random.randint(1,6)
            print("Dice showed : ",dice)
            
            p1 = p1+dice
            p1 += check_snakeLadder()
            #after snake if, p1 becomes negative, make it 0,
            #as -ve is not available on board
            if(p1<0):
                p1=0
            
            if p1>end:
                p1=end
            print(p1Name, " Your Score : ",p1)
            if(reached_end(p1)):
                print(p1Name, " won")
                break
        else:
            print(p2Name, " Your turn")
            c = input("Press 1 to continue, 0 to exit : ")
            if(c==0):
                print(p1Name," Scored : ",p1)
                print(p2Name," Scored : ",p2)
                print("Quiting the game, bye")
                break
            #generate random number for dice
            dice = random.randint(1,6)
            print("Dice showed : ",dice)
            
            p2 = p2+dice
            p2 += check_snakeLadder() 
            #after snake if, p1 becomes negative, make it 0,
            #as -ve is not available on board
            if(p2<0):
                p2=0
            
            if p2>end:
                p2=end
            print(p2Name, " Your Score : ",p2)
            if(reached_end(p2)):
                print(p2Name, " won")
                break
        turn+=1
--- ==== Check for Snake or Ladder, End ==== A simple logic i have implemented here, which, mam left, for us to implement. When user rolls the dice, we will add new position to current position plus, number generated on dice. Now, we have to check whether,
  1. it is end or not, if it is end, the player wins.
    2. def reached_end(p):
    if(p>=end):
        return True
    return False
  2. it is snake, go down to the tail of snake
  3. it is ladder, to up to the top of ladder

#check whether snake or ladder is there or not
def check_snakeLadder():
    snakeLadder = random.randint(2,80)
    divisor = random.randint(2,9)
    #if ladder is there, return +snakeLadder
    if(snakeLadder % divisor == 0):
        print("Wow Ladder : ", snakeLadder)
        return(snakeLadder)
    #if snake is there, return -snakeLadder
    elif(snakeLadder % divisor > 5):
        print("Sorry Snake : ",snakeLadder)
        return(-snakeLadder)
    #neither snake or ladder is there
    else:
        print("Neither snake nor ladder : ")
        return 0
==== Code ==== --- 
"""
Created on Tue Sep 11 11:59:28 2018
@author: amichoksi
"""
from PIL import Image
import random
end=100

#show board image in a window
def show_board():
    img=Image.open('SNL.jpg')
    img.show()
#check reach end
def reached_end(p):
    if(p>=end):
        return True
    return False
#check whether snake or ladder is there or not
def check_snakeLadder():
    snakeLadder = random.randint(2,80)
    divisor = random.randint(2,9)
    #if ladder is there, return +snakeLadder
    if(snakeLadder % divisor == 0):
        print("Wow Ladder : ", snakeLadder)
        return(snakeLadder)
    #if snake is there, return -snakeLadder
    elif(snakeLadder % divisor > 5):
        print("Sorry Snake : ",snakeLadder)
        return(-snakeLadder)
    #neither snake or ladder is there
    else:
        print("Neither snake nor ladder : ")
        return 0    
#play
def play():
    #input player names
    p1Name=input("Player1 Name : ")
    p2Name=input("Players Name : ")
    #initial points of players
    p1=0
    p2=0
    turn=0
    while(1):
        if(turn%2==0):
            print(p1Name, " Your turn")
            c = input("Press 1 to continue, 0 to exit : ")
            if(c==0):
                print(p1Name," Scored : ",p1)
                print(p2Name," Scored : ",p2)
                print("Quiting the game, bye")
                break
            #generate random number for dice
            dice = random.randint(1,6)
            print("Dice showed : ",dice)
            
            p1 = p1+dice
            p1 += check_snakeLadder()
            #after snake if, p1 becomes negative, make it 0,
            #as -ve is not available on board
            if(p1<0):
                p1=0
            
            if p1>end:
                p1=end
            print(p1Name, " Your Score : ",p1)
            if(reached_end(p1)):
                print(p1Name, " won")
                break
        else:
            print(p2Name, " Your turn")
            c = input("Press 1 to continue, 0 to exit : ")
            if(c==0):
                print(p1Name," Scored : ",p1)
                print(p2Name," Scored : ",p2)
                print("Quiting the game, bye")
                break
            #generate random number for dice
            dice = random.randint(1,6)
            print("Dice showed : ",dice)
            
            p2 = p2+dice
            p2 += check_snakeLadder() 
            #after snake if, p1 becomes negative, make it 0,
            #as -ve is not available on board
            if(p2<0):
                p2=0
            
            if p2>end:
                p2=end
            print(p2Name, " Your Score : ",p2)
            if(reached_end(p2)):
                print(p2Name, " won")
                break
        turn+=1
#calling the board and play methods
show_board()    
play()

== GPS Tracker By Ms.Ami Tusharkant Choksi ==
=== Introduction ===
We want to track a person. For that, GPS(Global Positioning System) tracker is useful. The output of GPS tracker is in the form of latitude and longitude. They are the real numbers, that we cannot understand easily. To make it understandable easily, if places of those locations with names as text and map is shown, humans can understand very easily. That's what we are implementing here. 
=== Explanation for Code ===
---
To implement GPS tracker in Python language, we need 

    

  • csv file, wherein latitude and longitude are available
    • 

  • gmplot python module should be install
    • 

  • generate HTML file, that contains the Google map output of all data of route.csv file

  • browser wherein we will see output
    • 


---

28.689316,77.324165
28.689285,77.324062
28.689218,77.323948
28.689343,77.323858
28.689431,77.323807


---

import csv
reader = csv.reader(f)
    k=0
    for row in reader:
        lat = float(row[0])
        long = float(row[1])

 Generate the HTML file that has the google map output of all data of route.csv file

== GPS Tracker By Ms.Ami Tusharkant Choksi ==
=== Introduction ===
We want to track a person. For that, GPS(Global Positioning System) tracker is useful. The output of GPS tracker is in the form of latitude and longitude. They are the real numbers, that we cannot understand easily. To make it understandable easily, if places of those locations with names as text and map is shown, humans can understand very easily. That's what we are implementing here. 
=== Explanation for Code ===
---
To implement GPS tracker in Python language, we need 

    

  • csv file, wherein latitude and longitude are available
    • 

  • gmplot python module should be install
    • 

  • generate HTML file, that contains the Google map output of all data of route.csv file

  • browser wherein we will see output
    • 


---

=== route.csv ===
route.csv file, as shared by Amitsir, is having data in the following format.

28.689519,77.324495
28.689431,77.324347
28.689316,77.324165
28.689285,77.324062
28.689218,77.323948
28.689343,77.323858
28.689431,77.323807


---

=== read csv file ===
Import the csv module and using the reader get values of longtitude and latitude from file.

import csv
reader = csv.reader(f)
    k=0
    for row in reader:
        lat = float(row[0])
        long = float(row[1])


=== Use of gmplot module ===
Check whether gmplot is installed or not on your system. For that on your python shell, write, 

from gmplot import gmplot


If it, gives any error, it means, gmplot module is not installed on your machine. One can install gmplot using

pip3 install gmplot


on Ubuntu or linux compatible machines. The required code for generating HTML file, from google map is as follows:


# import gmplot package 
import gmplot 
  
# GoogleMapPlotter return Map object 
# Pass the center latitude and 
# center longitude 
gmap = gmplot.GoogleMapPlotter(28.689169, 77.324448,17)
#set icon set Google marker icon
gmap.coloricon = "http://www.googlemapsmarkers.com/v1/%s/"

gmap.marker(lat,long,'yellow') #setting the marker of yellow color for start

 
Setting the marker for start as yellow color, last as red and others as blue color.

 Generate the HTML file that has the google map output of all data of route.csv file


gmap.draw("mymap.html")

---

=== Code ===

import csv
#check if module is available or not
#on python shell
#from gmplot import gmplot        
#if not available, install it
#pip3 install gmplot        

from gmplot import gmplot
gmap = gmplot.GoogleMapPlotter(28.689169, 77.324448,17)
gmap.coloricon = "http://www.googlemapsmarkers.com/v1/%s/"
        
with open("route.csv","r") as f:
    reader = csv.reader(f)
    k=0
    for row in reader:
        lat = float(row[0])
        long = float(row[1])
        #print(lat)
        #print(long)
        #print()
        if(k==0):
            gmap.marker(lat,long,'yellow')
            k=1
        else:
            gmap.marker
            (lat,long,'blue')
gmap.marker(lat,long,'red')            
gmap.draw("mymap.html")
#open the mymap.html file

== Snakes and Ladders By Ms.Ami Tusharkant Choksi == ==== Introduction ==== Snakes and ladders is a very popular game. Two or more players can play the game together. '''Board:''' The game is having board with numbers ranging from 1 to 100. Snakes and ladders are placed on the board in any direction, ranging from any number to any other number on the board.
'''Player:''' Each player has to roll a dice. Position of player, e.g. player1's cookie will be placed on new position, i.e. calculated from 
new position=current position + diceNumber
'''Snake or Ladder:''' There can be snake or ladder on the new position. If snake is there, user has to go down to the position of snake's tail. If ladder is there, user will reach to the position of top of the ladder. '''Win or loose:''' A player who reaches the number 100 on the board first, wins the game. === Explanation for the Code: === Vidyamam, in the lecture, taught us to create a board by loading the image on it. How players play and their position on the board is getting incremented by the dice generated number. She left the code for checking snake/ladder for us, that too i have implemented here, with a simple logic. --- ==== Show board ==== 
#show board image in a window
def show_board():
    img=Image.open('SNL.jpg')
    img.show()
--- [[File:SNL.jpg]] --- ==== Play ==== Explanation: Playing is, one by one, user will roll a dice. i.e. here we will generate random no. For that importing random is required. --- 
#play
def play():
    #input player names
    p1Name=input("Player1 Name : ")
    p2Name=input("Players Name : ")
    #initial points of players
    p1=0
    p2=0
    turn=0
    while(1):
        if(turn%2==0):
            print(p1Name, " Your turn")
            c = input("Press 1 to continue, 0 to exit : ")
            if(c==0):
                print(p1Name," Scored : ",p1)
                print(p2Name," Scored : ",p2)
                print("Quiting the game, bye")
                break
            #generate random number for dice
            dice = random.randint(1,6)
            print("Dice showed : ",dice)
            
            p1 = p1+dice
            p1 += check_snakeLadder()
            #after snake if, p1 becomes negative, make it 0,
            #as -ve is not available on board
            if(p1<0):
                p1=0
            
            if p1>end:
                p1=end
            print(p1Name, " Your Score : ",p1)
            if(reached_end(p1)):
                print(p1Name, " won")
                break
        else:
            print(p2Name, " Your turn")
            c = input("Press 1 to continue, 0 to exit : ")
            if(c==0):
                print(p1Name," Scored : ",p1)
                print(p2Name," Scored : ",p2)
                print("Quiting the game, bye")
                break
            #generate random number for dice
            dice = random.randint(1,6)
            print("Dice showed : ",dice)
            
            p2 = p2+dice
            p2 += check_snakeLadder() 
            #after snake if, p1 becomes negative, make it 0,
            #as -ve is not available on board
            if(p2<0):
                p2=0
            
            if p2>end:
                p2=end
            print(p2Name, " Your Score : ",p2)
            if(reached_end(p2)):
                print(p2Name, " won")
                break
        turn+=1
--- ==== Check for Snake or Ladder, End ==== A simple logic i have implemented here, which, mam left, for us to implement. When user rolls the dice, we will add new position to current position plus, number generated on dice. Now, we have to check whether,
  1. it is end or not, if it is end, the player wins.
    2. def reached_end(p):
    if(p>=end):
        return True
    return False
  2. it is snake, go down to the tail of snake
  3. it is ladder, to up to the top of ladder

#check whether snake or ladder is there or not
def check_snakeLadder():
    snakeLadder = random.randint(2,80)
    divisor = random.randint(2,9)
    #if ladder is there, return +snakeLadder
    if(snakeLadder % divisor == 0):
        print("Wow Ladder : ", snakeLadder)
        return(snakeLadder)
    #if snake is there, return -snakeLadder
    elif(snakeLadder % divisor > 5):
        print("Sorry Snake : ",snakeLadder)
        return(-snakeLadder)
    #neither snake or ladder is there
    else:
        print("Neither snake nor ladder : ")
        return 0

"""
Created on Tue Sep 11 11:59:28 2018
@author: amichoksi
"""
from PIL import Image
import random
end=100

#show board image in a window
def show_board():
    img=Image.open('SNL.jpg')
    img.show()
#check reach end
def reached_end(p):
    if(p>=end):
        return True
    return False
#check whether snake or ladder is there or not
def check_snakeLadder():
    snakeLadder = random.randint(2,80)
    divisor = random.randint(2,9)
    #if ladder is there, return +snakeLadder
    if(snakeLadder % divisor == 0):
        print("Wow Ladder : ", snakeLadder)
        return(snakeLadder)
    #if snake is there, return -snakeLadder
    elif(snakeLadder % divisor > 5):
        print("Sorry Snake : ",snakeLadder)
        return(-snakeLadder)
    #neither snake or ladder is there
    else:
        print("Neither snake nor ladder : ")
        return 0    
#play
def play():
    #input player names
    p1Name=input("Player1 Name : ")
    p2Name=input("Players Name : ")
    #initial points of players
    p1=0
    p2=0
    turn=0
    while(1):
        if(turn%2==0):
            print(p1Name, " Your turn")
            c = input("Press 1 to continue, 0 to exit : ")
            if(c==0):
                print(p1Name," Scored : ",p1)
                print(p2Name," Scored : ",p2)
                print("Quiting the game, bye")
                break
            #generate random number for dice
            dice = random.randint(1,6)
            print("Dice showed : ",dice)
            
            p1 = p1+dice
            p1 += check_snakeLadder()
            #after snake if, p1 becomes negative, make it 0,
            #as -ve is not available on board
            if(p1<0):
                p1=0
            
            if p1>end:
                p1=end
            print(p1Name, " Your Score : ",p1)
            if(reached_end(p1)):
                print(p1Name, " won")
                break
        else:
            print(p2Name, " Your turn")
            c = input("Press 1 to continue, 0 to exit : ")
            if(c==0):
                print(p1Name," Scored : ",p1)
                print(p2Name," Scored : ",p2)
                print("Quiting the game, bye")
                break
            #generate random number for dice
            dice = random.randint(1,6)
            print("Dice showed : ",dice)
            
            p2 = p2+dice
            p2 += check_snakeLadder() 
            #after snake if, p1 becomes negative, make it 0,
            #as -ve is not available on board
            if(p2<0):
                p2=0
            
            if p2>end:
                p2=end
            print(p2Name, " Your Score : ",p2)
            if(reached_end(p2)):
                print(p2Name, " won")
                break
        turn+=1
#calling the board and play methods
show_board()    
play()
