--- ---- == Snake and Ladder By Sachin == ---- Following code is designed to play old and classic game "Sankes and Ladder" '''Rules:''' 
1. Both players start from Zero
2. Each player get a chance to roll a dice one by one.
3. Player have to move forward(steps) as number comes on the dice.
4. there are 2 obstacle in path Snakes and Ladders. 
    * Ladder: Once any player reached the ladder point He will climb up and gain extra steps.
    * Snake: Once any player reached the snake point. He will move downward and lose the steps. 
5. The player who reached the 100 block first will be winner.
'''Features:''' 
1. Player turn is randomly selected first time.
2. Player can use "Show" to see the board and their position.
3. The numbers on board are arranged in a zig zag manner as we see on original board.
4. Board block structure is almost near to real.
5. We can extend the player number with very few modification.
'''Working:''' 
* Initially player enter their names
* First turn is  randomly selected with the help of random.randint functionality.
* Snake and Ladder function will be called with every turn. These function just check whether player reach any predefined ladder or snake position. If so, they print the msg. 
  - Snake name will be randomly selected from list while printing the msg.
* If player reached the 100 block as per player and 9,9 index of matrix. Player will be declared winner and program will be terminated.
* If both player attain the same position. Player name will be concatenated. 
* Position function is used to update the player position after every dice roll.
* Fill function is used to previous position of player as it move to new position.
Bug: Once both player attend same position. Players positions are not properly visible on board once they both one turn at-least. 
print('''
  ____              _                          _   _              _     _           
 / ___| _ __   __ _| | _____    __ _ _ __   __| | | |    __ _  __| | __| | ___ _ __ 
 \___ \| '_ \ / _` | |/ / _ \  / _` | '_ \ / _` | | |   / _` |/ _` |/ _` |/ _ \ '__|
  ___) | | | | (_| |   <  __/ | (_| | | | | (_| | | |__| (_| | (_| | (_| |  __/ |   
 |____/|_| |_|\__,_|_|\_\___|  \__,_|_| |_|\__,_| |_____\__,_|\__,_|\__,_|\___|_|      
                                                                                                                                                                                     
 ''')
import random
    
def dice():
    return random.randrange(1, 7)
def showboard():
    board.reverse()
    for i in range(10):
        for j in range(10):
            print(board[i][j], end = "    ")
        print("\n")
    board.reverse()
def position(pos, p, old):
   
    col = int(pos%10)
    row = int(pos/10)
    if row%2 == 0:   
        o_number = board[row][col]
        board[row][col] = p        
    else:
        temp = []
        for i in range(10):
            temp.append(board[row][i])
        temp.reverse()
        o_number = temp[col]
        temp[col] = p
        temp.reverse()
        for i in range(10):
            board[row][i] = temp[i]
    try:
        old = int(old) - 1       
        if old <= 0:
            exit
        else:
            fill(old)
    except ValueError:
        exit                                                       
    return o_number

def fill(pos):        
    col = int(pos)%10
    row = int(pos/10)
    if row%2 == 0:   
        board[row][col] = pos+1        
    else:
        temp = []
        for i in range(10):
            temp.append(board[row][i])
        temp.reverse()
        temp[col] = pos+1
        temp.reverse()
        for i in range(10):
            board[row][i]=temp[i]

def snake(pos, p, old):
    con = False
    a = ["King Kobra", "Anaconda", "Rattlesnake", "Death Adder", "Black Mamba" ]
    s_list= [32, 52, 78, 98]
    m_list= [2, 15, 23, 8]
    snake_l = random.choice(a)
    for i in range(len(s_list)):
        if s_list[i] == pos:
            pos = m_list[i]
            print("Oooppss!!! you just bitten by",snake_l,"and slide from", s_list[i], "to", pos)
            con = True
            position(pos-1, p, old)
    return pos-1, con      
            
def ladder(pos, p, old):
    con = False
    s_ladder = [7, 23, 41, 68]
    m_ladder = [29, 74, 93, 89]
    for i in range(len(s_ladder)):
        if s_ladder[i] == pos:
            pos = m_ladder[i]
            print("Waaooo!!! you just found a ladder and climbed from", s_ladder[i], "to", pos)
            con = True
            position(pos-1, p, old)
    return pos-1, con   

p1 = input("Player one enter your name\n")
p2 = input("Player Two enter your name\n")


board = []
s = 0
for i in range (10):
    tboard=[]
    for j in range(10):
        s += 1
        tboard.append(s)
    if i%2 == 0:
        board.append(tboard)
    else:
        tboard.reverse()
        board.append(tboard)

T = random.randint(0, 1)
p1position = 0
p2position = 0
win = True
o_number1 = 0
o_number2 = 0
while win:    
    if T == 0:
        print(p1, "enter 'r' to roll the dice and 'show' to see the board")
        a = input()
        a = a.lower()
        if a == "r":
            p1number = dice()
            print("Dice shows:", p1number, "\n")
            if p1position == 0:
                p1position = p1position + p1number -1
            else:
                p1position = p1position + p1number
            p1position, scon = snake(p1position+1, p1, o_number1)
            p1position, lcon = ladder(p1position+1, p1, o_number1)
            if scon == True or lcon == True:
                T = 1
                exit
            else:    
                if p1position == 99:
                    print(p1, "has won the game \a")
                    win = False
                elif p1position == p2position and p1position <= 99 and p2position <= 99:
                    o_number1 = position(p1position, p1+p2, o_number1)
                    T =1
                elif p1position > 99:
                    p1position = p1position - p1number
                    T =1
                else:
                    o_number1 = position(p1position, p1, o_number1)
                    T = 1
        elif a == "show":
            showboard()
        else:
            print("Enter valid input")      
    elif T == 1:
        print(p2, "enter 'r' to roll the dice and 'show' to see the board")
        b = input()
        b = b.lower()
        if b == "r":
            p2number = dice()
            print("Dice shows:", p2number, "\n")
            if p2position == 0:
                p2position = p2position + p2number -1
            else:
                p2position = p2position + p2number
            p2position, scon = snake(p2position+1, p2, o_number2)
            p2position, lcon = ladder(p2position+1, p2, o_number2)
            if scon == True or lcon == True:
                T = 0
                exit
            else:
                if p2position == 99:
                    print(p2, "has won the game")
                    win = False
                elif p1position == p2position and p1position < 99 and p2position < 99:
                    o_number2 = position(p2position, p1+p2, o_number2)
                    T = 0
                elif p2position > 99:
                    p2position = p2position - p2number
                    T =0
                else:
                    o_number2 = position(p2position, p2, o_number2)
                    T = 0
        elif b == "show":
            showboard()
        else:
            print("Enter valid input")

=== Code === We will see the code in two parts:
  1. Textually

=== Spiral Traversal of Matrix Textually === Steps to print the matrix 'a' with rows 'm' and columns 'n' 
1. Initialise the index for row and column (k = 0 and l = 0)
2. Repeat step 3 through step 6 till the rows and columns are exhausted
3. Print k th row; Increment k to next row
4. Print the (n-1)th column; decrement n by one (Shrink the matrix by one column)
5. If rows of the matrix not exhausted, Print m th row (last row); Decrement m by one (Shrink the matrix by one row)
6. If columns of the matrix not exhausted, Print the first column in reverse manner; Increment the column index to 
   look for next column

def spiral(m,n,a):                         # m - row, n - column and a- matrix to print

    l=0                                    # l = index of starting column

== GPS Tracker By Ms.Ami Tusharkant Choksi ==
=== Introduction ===
We want to track a person. For that, GPS(Global Positioning System) tracker is useful. The output of GPS tracker is in the form of latitude and longitude. They are the real numbers, that we cannot understand easily. To make it understandable easily, if places of those locations with names as text and map is shown, humans can understand very easily. That's what we are implementing here. 
=== Explanation for Code ===
---
To implement GPS tracker in Python language, we need 

    

  • csv file, wherein latitude and longitude are available
    • 

  • gmplot python module should be install
    • 

  • generate HTML file, that contains the Google map output of all data of route.csv file

  • browser wherein we will see output
    • 


---

=== Contents of route.csv ===
route.csv file, as shared by Amitsir, is having data in the following format.

28.689519,77.324495
28.689431,77.324347
28.689316,77.324165
28.689285,77.324062
28.689218,77.323948
28.689343,77.323858
28.689431,77.323807


---

=== Read csv file ===
Import the csv module and using the reader get values of longtitude and latitude from file.

import csv
reader = csv.reader(f)
    k=0
    for row in reader:
        lat = float(row[0])
        long = float(row[1])

Check whether gmplot is installed or not on your system. For that on your python shell, write, 

from gmplot import gmplot


If it, gives any error, it means, gmplot module is not installed on your machine. One can install gmplot using

pip3 install gmplot


on Ubuntu or linux compatible machines. The required code for generating HTML file, from google map is as follows:

# GoogleMapPlotter return Map object 
# Pass the center latitude and

#set icon set Google marker icon
gmap.coloricon = "http://www.googlemapsmarkers.com/v1/%s/"

gmap.marker(lat,long,'yellow') #setting the marker of yellow color for start

 
Setting the marker for start as yellow color, last as red and others as blue color.

 Generate the HTML file that has the google map output of all data of route.csv file


gmap.draw("mymap.html")

'''Board:''' The game is having board with numbers ranging from 1 to 100. Snakes and ladders are placed on the board in any direction, ranging from any number to any other number on the board.
'''Player:''' Each player has to roll a dice. Position of player, e.g. player1's cookie will be placed on new position, i.e. calculated from

'''Snake or Ladder:''' There can be snake or ladder on the new position. If snake is there, user has to go down to the position of snake's tail. If ladder is there, user will reach to the position of top of the ladder. '''Win or loose:''' A player who reaches the number 100 on the board first, wins the game. === Explanation for the Code: === Vidyamam, in the lecture, taught us to create a board by loading the image on it. How players play and their position on the board is getting incremented by the dice generated number. #play
def play():
    #input player names
    p1Name=input("Player1 Name : ")
    p2Name=input("Players Name : ")
    #initial points of players
    p1=0
    p2=0
    turn=0
    while(1):
        if(turn%2==0):
            print(p1Name, " Your turn")
            c = input("Press 1 to continue, 0 to exit : ")
            if(c==0):
                print(p1Name," Scored : ",p1)
                print(p2Name," Scored : ",p2)
                print("Quiting the game, bye")
                break
            #generate random number for dice
            dice = random.randint(1,6)
            print("Dice showed : ",dice)
            
            p1 = p1+dice
            p1 += check_snakeLadder()
            #after snake if, p1 becomes negative, make it 0,
            #as -ve is not available on board
            if(p1<0):
                p1=0
            
            if p1>end:
                p1=end
            print(p1Name, " Your Score : ",p1)
            if(reached_end(p1)):
                print(p1Name, " won")
                break
        else:
            print(p2Name, " Your turn")
            c = input("Press 1 to continue, 0 to exit : ")
            if(c==0):
                print(p1Name," Scored : ",p1)
                print(p2Name," Scored : ",p2)
                print("Quiting the game, bye")
                break

def check_snakeLadder():
    snakeLadder = random.randint(2,80)
    divisor = random.randint(2,9)
    #if ladder is there, return +snakeLadder
    if(snakeLadder % divisor == 0):

==== Code ==== --- 
"""
Created on Tue Sep 11 11:59:28 2018
@author: amichoksi
"""
from PIL import Image
import random
end=100

#show board image in a window
def show_board():
    img=Image.open('SNL.jpg')
    img.show()
#check reach end
def reached_end(p):
    if(p>=end):
        return True
    return False
#check whether snake or ladder is there or not
def check_snakeLadder():
    snakeLadder = random.randint(2,80)
    divisor = random.randint(2,9)
    #if ladder is there, return +snakeLadder
    if(snakeLadder % divisor == 0):
        print("Wow Ladder : ", snakeLadder)
        return(snakeLadder)
    #if snake is there, return -snakeLadder
    elif(snakeLadder % divisor > 5):
        print("Sorry Snake : ",snakeLadder)
        return(-snakeLadder)
    #neither snake or ladder is there
    else:
        print("Neither snake nor ladder : ")
        return 0    
#play
def play():
    #input player names
    p1Name=input("Player1 Name : ")
    p2Name=input("Players Name : ")
    #initial points of players
    p1=0
    p2=0
    turn=0
    while(1):
        if(turn%2==0):
            print(p1Name, " Your turn")
            c = input("Press 1 to continue, 0 to exit : ")
            if(c==0):
                print(p1Name," Scored : ",p1)
                print(p2Name," Scored : ",p2)
                print("Quiting the game, bye")
                break
            #generate random number for dice
            dice = random.randint(1,6)
            print("Dice showed : ",dice)
            
            p1 = p1+dice
            p1 += check_snakeLadder()
            #after snake if, p1 becomes negative, make it 0,
            #as -ve is not available on board
            if(p1<0):
                p1=0
            
            if p1>end:
                p1=end
            print(p1Name, " Your Score : ",p1)
            if(reached_end(p1)):
                print(p1Name, " won")
                break
        else:
            print(p2Name, " Your turn")
            c = input("Press 1 to continue, 0 to exit : ")
            if(c==0):
                print(p1Name," Scored : ",p1)
                print(p2Name," Scored : ",p2)
                print("Quiting the game, bye")
                break
            #generate random number for dice
            dice = random.randint(1,6)
            print("Dice showed : ",dice)
            
            p2 = p2+dice
            p2 += check_snakeLadder() 
            #after snake if, p1 becomes negative, make it 0,
            #as -ve is not available on board
            if(p2<0):
                p2=0
            
            if p2>end:
                p2=end
            print(p2Name, " Your Score : ",p2)
            if(reached_end(p2)):
                print(p2Name, " won")
                break
        turn+=1
#calling the board and play methods
show_board()    
play()

--- ---- == Snake and Ladder By Sachin == ---- Following code is designed to play old and classic game "Sankes and Ladder" '''Rules:''' 
1. Both players start from Zero
2. Each player get a chance to roll a dice one by one.
3. Player have to move forward(steps) as number comes on the dice.
4. there are 2 obstacle in path Snakes and Ladders. 
    * Ladder: Once any player reached the ladder point He will climb up and gain extra steps.
    * Snake: Once any player reached the snake point. He will move downward and lose the steps. 
5. The player who reached the 100 block first will be winner.
'''Features:''' 
1. Player turn is randomly selected first time.
2. Player can use "Show" to see the board and their position.
3. The numbers on board are arranged in a zig zag manner as we see on original board.
4. Board block structure is almost near to real.
5. We can extend the player number with very few modification.
'''Working:''' 
* Initially player enter their names
* First turn is  randomly selected with the help of random.randint functionality.
* Snake and Ladder function will be called with every turn. These function just check whether player reach any predefined ladder or snake position. If so, they print the msg. 
  - Snake name will be randomly selected from list while printing the msg.
* If player reached the 100 block as per player and 9,9 index of matrix. Player will be declared winner and program will be terminated.
* If both player attain the same position. Player name will be concatenated. 
* Position function is used to update the player position after every dice roll.
* Fill function is used to previous position of player as it move to new position.
Bug: Once both player attend same position. Players positions are not properly visible on board once they both one turn at-least. 
print('''
  ____              _                          _   _              _     _

  ___) | | | | (_| |   <  __/ | (_| | | | | (_| | | |__| (_| | (_| | (_| |  __/ |   
 |____/|_| |_|\__,_|_|\_\___|  \__,_|_| |_|\__,_| |_____\__,_|\__,_|\__,_|\___|_|      
                                                                                                                                                                                     
 ''')
import random
    
def dice():
    return random.randrange(1, 7)
def showboard():
    board.reverse()
    for i in range(10):
        for j in range(10):
            print(board[i][j], end = "    ")
        print("\n")
    board.reverse()
def position(pos, p, old):
   
    col = int(pos%10)
    row = int(pos/10)
    if row%2 == 0:   
        o_number = board[row][col]
        board[row][col] = p        
    else:
        temp = []
        for i in range(10):
            temp.append(board[row][i])
        temp.reverse()
        o_number = temp[col]
        temp[col] = p
        temp.reverse()
        for i in range(10):
            board[row][i] = temp[i]
    try:
        old = int(old) - 1       
        if old <= 0:
            exit
        else:
            fill(old)
    except ValueError:
        exit                                                       
    return o_number

def fill(pos):        
    col = int(pos)%10
    row = int(pos/10)
    if row%2 == 0:   
        board[row][col] = pos+1        
    else:
        temp = []
        for i in range(10):
            temp.append(board[row][i])
        temp.reverse()
        temp[col] = pos+1
        temp.reverse()
        for i in range(10):
            board[row][i]=temp[i]

def snake(pos, p, old):
    con = False
    a = ["King Kobra", "Anaconda", "Rattlesnake", "Death Adder", "Black Mamba" ]
    s_list= [32, 52, 78, 98]
    m_list= [2, 15, 23, 8]
    snake_l = random.choice(a)
    for i in range(len(s_list)):
        if s_list[i] == pos:
            pos = m_list[i]
            print("Oooppss!!! you just bitten by",snake_l,"and slide from", s_list[i], "to", pos)
            con = True
            position(pos-1, p, old)
    return pos-1, con      
            
def ladder(pos, p, old):
    con = False
    s_ladder = [7, 23, 41, 68]
    m_ladder = [29, 74, 93, 89]
    for i in range(len(s_ladder)):
        if s_ladder[i] == pos:
            pos = m_ladder[i]
            print("Waaooo!!! you just found a ladder and climbed from", s_ladder[i], "to", pos)
            con = True
            position(pos-1, p, old)
    return pos-1, con

p2 = input("Player Two enter your name\n")

        board.append(tboard)

T = random.randint(0, 1)
p1position = 0
p2position = 0
win = True
o_number1 = 0
o_number2 = 0
while win:    
    if T == 0:
        print(p1, "enter 'r' to roll the dice and 'show' to see the board")
        a = input()
        a = a.lower()
        if a == "r":
            p1number = dice()
            print("Dice shows:", p1number, "\n")
            if p1position == 0:
                p1position = p1position + p1number -1
            else:
                p1position = p1position + p1number
            p1position, scon = snake(p1position+1, p1, o_number1)
            p1position, lcon = ladder(p1position+1, p1, o_number1)
            if scon == True or lcon == True:
                T = 1
                exit
            else:    
                if p1position == 99:
                    print(p1, "has won the game \a")
                    win = False
                elif p1position == p2position and p1position <= 99 and p2position <= 99:
                    o_number1 = position(p1position, p1+p2, o_number1)
                    T =1
                elif p1position > 99:
                    p1position = p1position - p1number
                    T =1
                else:
                    o_number1 = position(p1position, p1, o_number1)
                    T = 1
        elif a == "show":
            showboard()
        else:
            print("Enter valid input")      
    elif T == 1:
        print(p2, "enter 'r' to roll the dice and 'show' to see the board")
        b = input()

                p2position = p2position + p2number -1

            p2position, lcon = ladder(p2position+1, p2, o_number2)
            if scon == True or lcon == True:
                T = 0
                exit
            else:
                if p2position == 99:
                    print(p2, "has won the game")
                    win = False
                elif p1position == p2position and p1position < 99 and p2position < 99:
                    o_number2 = position(p2position, p1+p2, o_number2)
                    T = 0
                elif p2position > 99:
                    p2position = p2position - p2number
                    T =0
                else:
                    o_number2 = position(p2position, p2, o_number2)
                    T = 0
        elif b == "show":
            showboard()
        else:

=== Code === We will see the code in two parts:

  2. Graphically
=== Spiral Traversal of Matrix Textually === Steps to print the matrix 'a' with rows 'm' and columns 'n' 
1. Initialise the index for row and column (k = 0 and l = 0)
2. Repeat step 3 through step 6 till the rows and columns are exhausted
3. Print k th row; Increment k to next row
4. Print the (n-1)th column; decrement n by one (Shrink the matrix by one column)
5. If rows of the matrix not exhausted, Print m th row (last row); Decrement m by one (Shrink the matrix by one row)
6. If columns of the matrix not exhausted, Print the first column in reverse manner; Increment the column index to 
   look for next column

def spiral(m,n,a):                         # m - row, n - column and a- matrix to print
    k=0                                    # k = index of starting row
    l=0                                    # l = index of starting column 
    while(k

== GPS Tracker By Ms.Ami Tusharkant Choksi ==
=== Introduction ===
We want to track a person. For that, GPS(Global Positioning System) tracker is useful. The output of GPS tracker is in the form of latitude and longitude. They are the real numbers, that we cannot understand easily. To make it understandable easily, if places of those locations with names as text and map is shown, humans can understand very easily. That's what we are implementing here. 
=== Explanation for Code ===
---
To implement GPS tracker in Python language, we need 

    

  • csv file, wherein latitude and longitude are available
    • 

  • gmplot python module should be install
    • 

  • generate HTML file, that contains the Google map output of all data of route.csv file

  • browser wherein we will see output
    • 


---

=== Contents of route.csv ===
route.csv file, as shared by Amitsir, is having data in the following format.

28.689519,77.324495
28.689431,77.324347
28.689316,77.324165
28.689285,77.324062
28.689218,77.323948
28.689343,77.323858
28.689431,77.323807


---

=== Read csv file ===
Import the csv module and using the reader get values of longtitude and latitude from file.

import csv
reader = csv.reader(f)
    k=0
    for row in reader:
        lat = float(row[0])
        long = float(row[1])



=== Use of gmplot module ===
Check whether gmplot is installed or not on your system. For that on your python shell, write, 

from gmplot import gmplot


If it, gives any error, it means, gmplot module is not installed on your machine. One can install gmplot using

pip3 install gmplot


on Ubuntu or linux compatible machines. The required code for generating HTML file, from google map is as follows:


# import gmplot package 
import gmplot 
  
# GoogleMapPlotter return Map object 
# Pass the center latitude and 
# center longitude 
gmap = gmplot.GoogleMapPlotter(28.689169, 77.324448,17)
#set icon set Google marker icon
gmap.coloricon = "http://www.googlemapsmarkers.com/v1/%s/"

gmap.marker(lat,long,'yellow') #setting the marker of yellow color for start

 
Setting the marker for start as yellow color, last as red and others as blue color.

 Generate the HTML file that has the google map output of all data of route.csv file


gmap.draw("mymap.html")

---

=== Code ===

import csv
#check if module is available or not
#on python shell

#if not available, install it
#pip3 install gmplot        

from gmplot import gmplot
gmap = gmplot.GoogleMapPlotter(28.689169, 77.324448,17)
gmap.coloricon = "http://www.googlemapsmarkers.com/v1/%s/"
        
with open("route.csv","r") as f:
    reader = csv.reader(f)
    k=0
    for row in reader:
        lat = float(row[0])
        long = float(row[1])
        #print(lat)
        #print(long)
        #print()
        if(k==0):
            gmap.marker(lat,long,'yellow')
            k=1
        else:
            gmap.marker
            (lat,long,'blue')
gmap.marker(lat,long,'red')            
gmap.draw("mymap.html")

== Snakes and Ladders By Ms.Ami Tusharkant Choksi == ==== Introduction ==== Snakes and ladders is a very popular game. Two or more players can play the game together. '''Board:''' The game is having board with numbers ranging from 1 to 100. Snakes and ladders are placed on the board in any direction, ranging from any number to any other number on the board.
'''Player:''' Each player has to roll a dice. Position of player, e.g. player1's cookie will be placed on new position, i.e. calculated from 
new position=current position + diceNumber
'''Snake or Ladder:''' There can be snake or ladder on the new position. If snake is there, user has to go down to the position of snake's tail. If ladder is there, user will reach to the position of top of the ladder. '''Win or loose:''' A player who reaches the number 100 on the board first, wins the game. === Explanation for the Code: === Vidyamam, in the lecture, taught us to create a board by loading the image on it. How players play and their position on the board is getting incremented by the dice generated number. She left the code for checking snake/ladder for us, that too i have implemented here, with a simple logic. --- ==== Show board ==== 
#show board image in a window

    img=Image.open('SNL.jpg')
    img.show()

            p2 = p2+dice
            p2 += check_snakeLadder() 
            #after snake if, p1 becomes negative, make it 0,
            #as -ve is not available on board
            if(p2<0):
                p2=0
            
            if p2>end:
                p2=end
            print(p2Name, " Your Score : ",p2)
            if(reached_end(p2)):
                print(p2Name, " won")
                break
        turn+=1
#calling the board and play methods
show_board()    
play()

--- ---- == Snake and Ladder By Sachin == ---- Following code is designed to play old and classic game "Sankes and Ladder" '''Rules:''' 
1. Both players start from Zero
2. Each player get a chance to roll a dice one by one.
3. Player have to move forward(steps) as number comes on the dice.
4. there are 2 obstacle in path Snakes and Ladders. 
    * Ladder: Once any player reached the ladder point He will climb up and gain extra steps.
    * Snake: Once any player reached the snake point. He will move downward and lose the steps. 
5. The player who reached the 100 block first will be winner.
'''Features:''' 
1. Player turn is randomly selected first time.
2. Player can use "Show" to see the board and their position.
3. The numbers on board are arranged in a zig zag manner as we see on original board.
4. Board block structure is almost near to real.
5. We can extend the player number with very few modification.
'''Working:''' 
* Initially player enter their names
* First turn is  randomly selected with the help of random.randint functionality.
* Snake and Ladder function will be called with every turn. These function just check whether player reach any predefined ladder or snake position. If so, they print the msg. 
  - Snake name will be randomly selected from list while printing the msg.
* If player reached the 100 block as per player and 9,9 index of matrix. Player will be declared winner and program will be terminated.
* If both player attain the same position. Player name will be concatenated. 
* Position function is used to update the player position after every dice roll.
* Fill function is used to previous position of player as it move to new position.
Bug: Once both player attend same position. Players positions are not properly visible on board once they both one turn at-least. 
print('''
  ____              _                          _   _              _     _           
 / ___| _ __   __ _| | _____    __ _ _ __   __| | | |    __ _  __| | __| | ___ _ __ 
 \___ \| '_ \ / _` | |/ / _ \  / _` | '_ \ / _` | | |   / _` |/ _` |/ _` |/ _ \ '__|
  ___) | | | | (_| |   <  __/ | (_| | | | | (_| | | |__| (_| | (_| | (_| |  __/ |   
 |____/|_| |_|\__,_|_|\_\___|  \__,_|_| |_|\__,_| |_____\__,_|\__,_|\__,_|\___|_|      
                                                                                                                                                                                     
 ''')
import random
    
def dice():
    return random.randrange(1, 7)
def showboard():
    board.reverse()
    for i in range(10):
        for j in range(10):
            print(board[i][j], end = "    ")
        print("\n")
    board.reverse()
def position(pos, p, old):
   
    col = int(pos%10)
    row = int(pos/10)
    if row%2 == 0:   
        o_number = board[row][col]
        board[row][col] = p        
    else:
        temp = []
        for i in range(10):
            temp.append(board[row][i])
        temp.reverse()
        o_number = temp[col]
        temp[col] = p
        temp.reverse()
        for i in range(10):
            board[row][i] = temp[i]
    try:
        old = int(old) - 1       
        if old <= 0:
            exit
        else:
            fill(old)
    except ValueError:
        exit                                                       
    return o_number

def fill(pos):        
    col = int(pos)%10
    row = int(pos/10)
    if row%2 == 0:   
        board[row][col] = pos+1        
    else:
        temp = []
        for i in range(10):
            temp.append(board[row][i])
        temp.reverse()
        temp[col] = pos+1
        temp.reverse()
        for i in range(10):
            board[row][i]=temp[i]

def snake(pos, p, old):
    con = False
    a = ["King Kobra", "Anaconda", "Rattlesnake", "Death Adder", "Black Mamba" ]
    s_list= [32, 52, 78, 98]
    m_list= [2, 15, 23, 8]
    snake_l = random.choice(a)
    for i in range(len(s_list)):
        if s_list[i] == pos:
            pos = m_list[i]
            print("Oooppss!!! you just bitten by",snake_l,"and slide from", s_list[i], "to", pos)
            con = True
            position(pos-1, p, old)
    return pos-1, con      
            
def ladder(pos, p, old):
    con = False
    s_ladder = [7, 23, 41, 68]
    m_ladder = [29, 74, 93, 89]
    for i in range(len(s_ladder)):
        if s_ladder[i] == pos:
            pos = m_ladder[i]
            print("Waaooo!!! you just found a ladder and climbed from", s_ladder[i], "to", pos)
            con = True
            position(pos-1, p, old)
    return pos-1, con   

p1 = input("Player one enter your name\n")
p2 = input("Player Two enter your name\n")


board = []
s = 0
for i in range (10):
    tboard=[]
    for j in range(10):
        s += 1
        tboard.append(s)
    if i%2 == 0:
        board.append(tboard)
    else:
        tboard.reverse()
        board.append(tboard)

T = random.randint(0, 1)
p1position = 0
p2position = 0
win = True
o_number1 = 0
o_number2 = 0
while win:    
    if T == 0:
        print(p1, "enter 'r' to roll the dice and 'show' to see the board")
        a = input()
        a = a.lower()
        if a == "r":
            p1number = dice()
            print("Dice shows:", p1number, "\n")
            if p1position == 0:
                p1position = p1position + p1number -1
            else:
                p1position = p1position + p1number
            p1position, scon = snake(p1position+1, p1, o_number1)
            p1position, lcon = ladder(p1position+1, p1, o_number1)
            if scon == True or lcon == True:
                T = 1
                exit
            else:    
                if p1position == 99:
                    print(p1, "has won the game \a")
                    win = False
                elif p1position == p2position and p1position <= 99 and p2position <= 99:
                    o_number1 = position(p1position, p1+p2, o_number1)
                    T =1
                elif p1position > 99:
                    p1position = p1position - p1number
                    T =1
                else:
                    o_number1 = position(p1position, p1, o_number1)
                    T = 1
        elif a == "show":
            showboard()
        else:
            print("Enter valid input")      
    elif T == 1:
        print(p2, "enter 'r' to roll the dice and 'show' to see the board")
        b = input()
        b = b.lower()
        if b == "r":
            p2number = dice()
            print("Dice shows:", p2number, "\n")
            if p2position == 0:
                p2position = p2position + p2number -1
            else:
                p2position = p2position + p2number
            p2position, scon = snake(p2position+1, p2, o_number2)
            p2position, lcon = ladder(p2position+1, p2, o_number2)
            if scon == True or lcon == True:
                T = 0
                exit
            else:
                if p2position == 99:
                    print(p2, "has won the game")
                    win = False
                elif p1position == p2position and p1position < 99 and p2position < 99:
                    o_number2 = position(p2position, p1+p2, o_number2)
                    T = 0
                elif p2position > 99:
                    p2position = p2position - p2number
                    T =0
                else:
                    o_number2 = position(p2position, p2, o_number2)
                    T = 0
        elif b == "show":
            showboard()
        else:
            print("Enter valid input")
'''Sample Output:''' [[File:Snake&Ladder M.jpg]] [[FIle:Snakeladder won.jpg]] == Spiral Traversal By Ms.Ami Tusharkant Choksi == === Introduction === Generally we print the matrix row wise or column wise. Instead the matrix can be printed in a spiral.
Text Spiral Graphical Spiral
[[File:Spiral_matrix.JPG|200px]] [[File:RectSpiral.jpg|200px]]
=== Code === We will see the code in two parts:
  1. Textually
  2. Graphically
=== Spiral Traversal of Matrix Textually === Steps to print the matrix 'a' with rows 'm' and columns 'n' 
1. Initialise the index for row and column (k = 0 and l = 0)
2. Repeat step 3 through step 6 till the rows and columns are exhausted
3. Print k th row; Increment k to next row
4. Print the (n-1)th column; decrement n by one (Shrink the matrix by one column)
5. If rows of the matrix not exhausted, Print m th row (last row); Decrement m by one (Shrink the matrix by one row)
6. If columns of the matrix not exhausted, Print the first column in reverse manner; Increment the column index to 
   look for next column
Program 
def spiral(m,n,a):                         # m - row, n - column and a- matrix to print
    k=0                                    # k = index of starting row
    l=0                                    # l = index of starting column 
    while(k

== GPS Tracker By Ms.Ami Tusharkant Choksi ==
=== Introduction ===
We want to track a person. For that, GPS(Global Positioning System) tracker is useful. The output of GPS tracker is in the form of latitude and longitude. They are the real numbers, that we cannot understand easily. To make it understandable easily, if places of those locations with names as text and map is shown, humans can understand very easily. That's what we are implementing here. 
=== Explanation for Code ===
---
To implement GPS tracker in Python language, we need 

    

  • csv file, wherein latitude and longitude are available
    • 

  • gmplot python module should be install
    • 

  • generate HTML file, that contains the Google map output of all data of route.csv file

  • browser wherein we will see output
    • 


---

=== Contents of route.csv ===
route.csv file, as shared by Amitsir, is having data in the following format.

28.689519,77.324495
28.689431,77.324347
28.689316,77.324165
28.689285,77.324062
28.689218,77.323948
28.689343,77.323858
28.689431,77.323807


---

=== Read csv file ===
Import the csv module and using the reader get values of longtitude and latitude from file.

import csv
reader = csv.reader(f)
    k=0
    for row in reader:
        lat = float(row[0])
        long = float(row[1])



=== Use of gmplot module ===
Check whether gmplot is installed or not on your system. For that on your python shell, write, 

from gmplot import gmplot


If it, gives any error, it means, gmplot module is not installed on your machine. One can install gmplot using

pip3 install gmplot


on Ubuntu or linux compatible machines. The required code for generating HTML file, from google map is as follows:


# import gmplot package 
import gmplot 
  
# GoogleMapPlotter return Map object 
# Pass the center latitude and 
# center longitude 
gmap = gmplot.GoogleMapPlotter(28.689169, 77.324448,17)
#set icon set Google marker icon
gmap.coloricon = "http://www.googlemapsmarkers.com/v1/%s/"

gmap.marker(lat,long,'yellow') #setting the marker of yellow color for start

 
Setting the marker for start as yellow color, last as red and others as blue color.

 Generate the HTML file that has the google map output of all data of route.csv file


gmap.draw("mymap.html")

---

=== Code ===

import csv
#check if module is available or not
#on python shell
#from gmplot import gmplot        
#if not available, install it
#pip3 install gmplot        

from gmplot import gmplot
gmap = gmplot.GoogleMapPlotter(28.689169, 77.324448,17)
gmap.coloricon = "http://www.googlemapsmarkers.com/v1/%s/"
        
with open("route.csv","r") as f:
    reader = csv.reader(f)
    k=0
    for row in reader:
        lat = float(row[0])
        long = float(row[1])
        #print(lat)
        #print(long)
        #print()
        if(k==0):
            gmap.marker(lat,long,'yellow')
            k=1
        else:
            gmap.marker
            (lat,long,'blue')
gmap.marker(lat,long,'red')            
gmap.draw("mymap.html")
#open the mymap.html file

== Snakes and Ladders By Ms.Ami Tusharkant Choksi == ==== Introduction ==== Snakes and ladders is a very popular game. Two or more players can play the game together. '''Board:''' The game is having board with numbers ranging from 1 to 100. Snakes and ladders are placed on the board in any direction, ranging from any number to any other number on the board.
'''Player:''' Each player has to roll a dice. Position of player, e.g. player1's cookie will be placed on new position, i.e. calculated from 
new position=current position + diceNumber
'''Snake or Ladder:''' There can be snake or ladder on the new position. If snake is there, user has to go down to the position of snake's tail. If ladder is there, user will reach to the position of top of the ladder. '''Win or loose:''' A player who reaches the number 100 on the board first, wins the game. === Explanation for the Code: === Vidyamam, in the lecture, taught us to create a board by loading the image on it. How players play and their position on the board is getting incremented by the dice generated number. She left the code for checking snake/ladder for us, that too i have implemented here, with a simple logic. --- ==== Show board ==== 
#show board image in a window
def show_board():
    img=Image.open('SNL.jpg')
    img.show()
--- [[File:SNL.jpg]] --- ==== Play ==== Explanation: Playing is, one by one, user will roll a dice. i.e. here we will generate random no. For that importing random is required. --- 
#play
def play():
    #input player names
    p1Name=input("Player1 Name : ")
    p2Name=input("Players Name : ")
    #initial points of players
    p1=0
    p2=0
    turn=0
    while(1):
        if(turn%2==0):
            print(p1Name, " Your turn")
            c = input("Press 1 to continue, 0 to exit : ")
            if(c==0):
                print(p1Name," Scored : ",p1)
                print(p2Name," Scored : ",p2)
                print("Quiting the game, bye")
                break
            #generate random number for dice
            dice = random.randint(1,6)
            print("Dice showed : ",dice)
            
            p1 = p1+dice
            p1 += check_snakeLadder()
            #after snake if, p1 becomes negative, make it 0,
            #as -ve is not available on board
            if(p1<0):
                p1=0
            
            if p1>end:
                p1=end
            print(p1Name, " Your Score : ",p1)
            if(reached_end(p1)):
                print(p1Name, " won")
                break
        else:
            print(p2Name, " Your turn")
            c = input("Press 1 to continue, 0 to exit : ")
            if(c==0):
                print(p1Name," Scored : ",p1)
                print(p2Name," Scored : ",p2)
                print("Quiting the game, bye")
                break
            #generate random number for dice
            dice = random.randint(1,6)
            print("Dice showed : ",dice)
            
            p2 = p2+dice
            p2 += check_snakeLadder() 
            #after snake if, p1 becomes negative, make it 0,
            #as -ve is not available on board
            if(p2<0):
                p2=0
            
            if p2>end:
                p2=end
            print(p2Name, " Your Score : ",p2)
            if(reached_end(p2)):
                print(p2Name, " won")
                break
        turn+=1
--- ==== Check for Snake or Ladder, End ==== A simple logic i have implemented here, which, mam left, for us to implement. When user rolls the dice, we will add new position to current position plus, number generated on dice. Now, we have to check whether,
  1. it is end or not, if it is end, the player wins.
    2. def reached_end(p):
    if(p>=end):
        return True
    return False
  2. it is snake, go down to the tail of snake
  3. it is ladder, to up to the top of ladder
    4. # a simple logic i have implemented here, which mam, left for us to implement
#check whether snake or ladder is there or not
def check_snakeLadder():
    snakeLadder = random.randint(2,80)
    divisor = random.randint(2,9)
    #if ladder is there, return +snakeLadder
    if(snakeLadder % divisor == 0):
        print("Wow Ladder : ", snakeLadder)
        return(snakeLadder)
    #if snake is there, return -snakeLadder
    elif(snakeLadder % divisor > 5):
        print("Sorry Snake : ",snakeLadder)
        return(-snakeLadder)
    #neither snake or ladder is there
    else:
        print("Neither snake nor ladder : ")
        return 0
==== Code ==== --- 
"""
Created on Tue Sep 11 11:59:28 2018
@author: amichoksi
"""
from PIL import Image
import random
end=100

#show board image in a window
def show_board():
    img=Image.open('SNL.jpg')
    img.show()
#check reach end
def reached_end(p):
    if(p>=end):
        return True
    return False
#check whether snake or ladder is there or not
def check_snakeLadder():
    snakeLadder = random.randint(2,80)
    divisor = random.randint(2,9)
    #if ladder is there, return +snakeLadder
    if(snakeLadder % divisor == 0):
        print("Wow Ladder : ", snakeLadder)
        return(snakeLadder)
    #if snake is there, return -snakeLadder
    elif(snakeLadder % divisor > 5):
        print("Sorry Snake : ",snakeLadder)
        return(-snakeLadder)
    #neither snake or ladder is there
    else:
        print("Neither snake nor ladder : ")
        return 0    
#play
def play():
    #input player names
    p1Name=input("Player1 Name : ")
    p2Name=input("Players Name : ")
    #initial points of players
    p1=0
    p2=0
    turn=0
    while(1):
        if(turn%2==0):
            print(p1Name, " Your turn")
            c = input("Press 1 to continue, 0 to exit : ")
            if(c==0):
                print(p1Name," Scored : ",p1)
                print(p2Name," Scored : ",p2)
                print("Quiting the game, bye")
                break
            #generate random number for dice
            dice = random.randint(1,6)
            print("Dice showed : ",dice)
            
            p1 = p1+dice
            p1 += check_snakeLadder()
            #after snake if, p1 becomes negative, make it 0,
            #as -ve is not available on board
            if(p1<0):
                p1=0
            
            if p1>end:
                p1=end
            print(p1Name, " Your Score : ",p1)
            if(reached_end(p1)):
                print(p1Name, " won")
                break
        else:
            print(p2Name, " Your turn")
            c = input("Press 1 to continue, 0 to exit : ")
            if(c==0):
                print(p1Name," Scored : ",p1)
                print(p2Name," Scored : ",p2)
                print("Quiting the game, bye")
                break
            #generate random number for dice
            dice = random.randint(1,6)
            print("Dice showed : ",dice)
            
            p2 = p2+dice
            p2 += check_snakeLadder() 
            #after snake if, p1 becomes negative, make it 0,
            #as -ve is not available on board
            if(p2<0):
                p2=0
            
            if p2>end:
                p2=end
            print(p2Name, " Your Score : ",p2)
            if(reached_end(p2)):
                print(p2Name, " won")
                break
        turn+=1
#calling the board and play methods
show_board()    
play()

        for i in range(10):
            temp.append(board[row][i])
        temp.reverse()
        o_number = temp[col]
        temp[col] = p
        temp.reverse()
        for i in range(10):
            board[row][i] = temp[i]
    try:
        old = int(old) - 1       
        if old <= 0:
            exit
        else:
            fill(old)
    except ValueError:
        exit                                                       
    return o_number

def fill(pos):        
    col = int(pos)%10
    row = int(pos/10)
    if row%2 == 0:   
        board[row][col] = pos+1        
    else:
        temp = []
        for i in range(10):
            temp.append(board[row][i])
        temp.reverse()
        temp[col] = pos+1
        temp.reverse()
        for i in range(10):
            board[row][i]=temp[i]

def snake(pos, p, old):
    con = False
    a = ["King Kobra", "Anaconda", "Rattlesnake", "Death Adder", "Black Mamba" ]
    s_list= [32, 52, 78, 98]
    m_list= [2, 15, 23, 8]
    snake_l = random.choice(a)
    for i in range(len(s_list)):
        if s_list[i] == pos:
            pos = m_list[i]
            print("Oooppss!!! you just bitten by",snake_l,"and slide from", s_list[i], "to", pos)
            con = True
            position(pos-1, p, old)
    return pos-1, con      
            
def ladder(pos, p, old):
    con = False
    s_ladder = [7, 23, 41, 68]
    m_ladder = [29, 74, 93, 89]
    for i in range(len(s_ladder)):
        if s_ladder[i] == pos:
            pos = m_ladder[i]
            print("Waaooo!!! you just found a ladder and climbed from", s_ladder[i], "to", pos)
            con = True
            position(pos-1, p, old)
    return pos-1, con

Text Spiral Graphical Spiral
[[File:Spiral_matrix.JPG|200px]] [[File:RectSpiral.jpg|200px]]
=== Code === We will see the code in two parts:
  1. Textually
  2. Graphically
=== Spiral Traversal of Matrix Textually === Steps to print the matrix 'a' with rows 'm' and columns 'n' 
1. Initialise the index for row and column (k = 0 and l = 0)
2. Repeat step 3 through step 6 till the rows and columns are exhausted
3. Print k th row; Increment k to next row
4. Print the (n-1)th column; decrement n by one (Shrink the matrix by one column)
5. If rows of the matrix not exhausted, Print m th row (last row); Decrement m by one (Shrink the matrix by one row)
6. If columns of the matrix not exhausted, Print the first column in reverse manner; Increment the column index to 
   look for next column
Program 
def spiral(m,n,a):                         # m - row, n - column and a- matrix to print
    k=0                                    # k = index of starting row
    l=0                                    # l = index of starting column 
    while(k

== GPS Tracker By Ms.Ami Tusharkant Choksi ==
=== Introduction ===
We want to track a person. For that, GPS(Global Positioning System) tracker is useful. The output of GPS tracker is in the form of latitude and longitude. They are the real numbers, that we cannot understand easily. To make it understandable easily, if places of those locations with names as text and map is shown, humans can understand very easily. That's what we are implementing here. 
=== Explanation for Code ===
---
To implement GPS tracker in Python language, we need 

    

  • csv file, wherein latitude and longitude are available
    • 

  • gmplot python module should be install
    • 

  • generate HTML file, that contains the Google map output of all data of route.csv file

  • browser wherein we will see output
    • 


---

=== Contents of route.csv ===
route.csv file, as shared by Amitsir, is having data in the following format.

28.689519,77.324495
28.689431,77.324347
28.689316,77.324165
28.689285,77.324062
28.689218,77.323948
28.689343,77.323858
28.689431,77.323807


---

=== Read csv file ===
Import the csv module and using the reader get values of longtitude and latitude from file.

import csv
reader = csv.reader(f)
    k=0
    for row in reader:
        lat = float(row[0])
        long = float(row[1])



=== Use of gmplot module ===
Check whether gmplot is installed or not on your system. For that on your python shell, write, 

from gmplot import gmplot


If it, gives any error, it means, gmplot module is not installed on your machine. One can install gmplot using

pip3 install gmplot


on Ubuntu or linux compatible machines. The required code for generating HTML file, from google map is as follows:


# import gmplot package 
import gmplot 
  
# GoogleMapPlotter return Map object 
# Pass the center latitude and 
# center longitude 
gmap = gmplot.GoogleMapPlotter(28.689169, 77.324448,17)
#set icon set Google marker icon
gmap.coloricon = "http://www.googlemapsmarkers.com/v1/%s/"

gmap.marker(lat,long,'yellow') #setting the marker of yellow color for start

 
Setting the marker for start as yellow color, last as red and others as blue color.

 Generate the HTML file that has the google map output of all data of route.csv file


gmap.draw("mymap.html")

---

gmap = gmplot.GoogleMapPlotter(28.689169, 77.324448,17)

            gmap.marker(lat,long,'yellow')

        else:
            gmap.marker
            (lat,long,'blue')

gmap.draw("mymap.html")

== Snakes and Ladders By Ms.Ami Tusharkant Choksi == ==== Introduction ==== Snakes and ladders is a very popular game. Two or more players can play the game together. '''Board:''' The game is having board with numbers ranging from 1 to 100. Snakes and ladders are placed on the board in any direction, ranging from any number to any other number on the board.
'''Player:''' Each player has to roll a dice. Position of player, e.g. player1's cookie will be placed on new position, i.e. calculated from 
new position=current position + diceNumber
'''Snake or Ladder:''' There can be snake or ladder on the new position. If snake is there, user has to go down to the position of snake's tail. If ladder is there, user will reach to the position of top of the ladder. '''Win or loose:''' A player who reaches the number 100 on the board first, wins the game. === Explanation for the Code: === Vidyamam, in the lecture, taught us to create a board by loading the image on it. How players play and their position on the board is getting incremented by the dice generated number. She left the code for checking snake/ladder for us, that too i have implemented here, with a simple logic. --- ==== Show board ==== 
#show board image in a window
def show_board():
    img=Image.open('SNL.jpg')
    img.show()
--- [[File:SNL.jpg]] --- ==== Play ==== Explanation: Playing is, one by one, user will roll a dice. i.e. here we will generate random no. For that importing random is required. ---

def play():
    #input player names

    p2Name=input("Players Name : ")

        if(turn%2==0):
            print(p1Name, " Your turn")

            if(c==0):
                print(p1Name," Scored : ",p1)
                print(p2Name," Scored : ",p2)
                print("Quiting the game, bye")
                break
            #generate random number for dice
            dice = random.randint(1,6)
            print("Dice showed : ",dice)
            
            p1 = p1+dice
            p1 += check_snakeLadder()
            #after snake if, p1 becomes negative, make it 0,
            #as -ve is not available on board
            if(p1<0):
                p1=0
            
            if p1>end:
                p1=end
            print(p1Name, " Your Score : ",p1)
            if(reached_end(p1)):
                print(p1Name, " won")
                break
        else:
            print(p2Name, " Your turn")
            c = input("Press 1 to continue, 0 to exit : ")
            if(c==0):
                print(p1Name," Scored : ",p1)
                print(p2Name," Scored : ",p2)
                print("Quiting the game, bye")
                break
            #generate random number for dice
            dice = random.randint(1,6)
            print("Dice showed : ",dice)
            
            p2 = p2+dice
            p2 += check_snakeLadder() 
            #after snake if, p1 becomes negative, make it 0,
            #as -ve is not available on board
            if(p2<0):
                p2=0
            
            if p2>end:
                p2=end
            print(p2Name, " Your Score : ",p2)
            if(reached_end(p2)):
                print(p2Name, " won")
                break
        turn+=1

def check_snakeLadder():
    snakeLadder = random.randint(2,80)
    divisor = random.randint(2,9)
    #if ladder is there, return +snakeLadder
    if(snakeLadder % divisor == 0):
        print("Wow Ladder : ", snakeLadder)
        return(snakeLadder)
    #if snake is there, return -snakeLadder
    elif(snakeLadder % divisor > 5):
        print("Sorry Snake : ",snakeLadder)
        return(-snakeLadder)
    #neither snake or ladder is there

        print("Neither snake nor ladder : ")
        return 0

from PIL import Image

end=100

#check reach end
def reached_end(p):
    if(p>=end):
        return True
    return False
#check whether snake or ladder is there or not
def check_snakeLadder():
    snakeLadder = random.randint(2,80)
    divisor = random.randint(2,9)
    #if ladder is there, return +snakeLadder
    if(snakeLadder % divisor == 0):
        print("Wow Ladder : ", snakeLadder)
        return(snakeLadder)
    #if snake is there, return -snakeLadder
    elif(snakeLadder % divisor > 5):
        print("Sorry Snake : ",snakeLadder)
        return(-snakeLadder)
    #neither snake or ladder is there
    else:
        print("Neither snake nor ladder : ")
        return 0    
#play

    #input player names

    p2Name=input("Players Name : ")

    p2=0

    while(1):
        if(turn%2==0):
            print(p1Name, " Your turn")
            c = input("Press 1 to continue, 0 to exit : ")
            if(c==0):
                print(p1Name," Scored : ",p1)
                print(p2Name," Scored : ",p2)
                print("Quiting the game, bye")
                break
            #generate random number for dice
            dice = random.randint(1,6)
            print("Dice showed : ",dice)
            
            p1 = p1+dice
            p1 += check_snakeLadder()
            #after snake if, p1 becomes negative, make it 0,
            #as -ve is not available on board
            if(p1<0):
                p1=0
            
            if p1>end:
                p1=end
            print(p1Name, " Your Score : ",p1)
            if(reached_end(p1)):
                print(p1Name, " won")
                break
        else:
            print(p2Name, " Your turn")

            if(c==0):

                break
        turn+=1

--- ---- == Snake and Ladder By Sachin == ---- Following code is designed to play old and classic game "Sankes and Ladder" '''Rules:''' 
1. Both players start from Zero
2. Each player get a chance to roll a dice one by one.
3. Player have to move forward(steps) as number comes on the dice.
4. there are 2 obstacle in path Snakes and Ladders. 
    * Ladder: Once any player reached the ladder point He will climb up and gain extra steps.
    * Snake: Once any player reached the snake point. He will move downward and lose the steps. 
5. The player who reached the 100 block first will be winner.
'''Features:''' 
1. Player turn is randomly selected first time.
2. Player can use "Show" to see the board and their position.
3. The numbers on board are arranged in a zig zag manner as we see on original board.
4. Board block structure is almost near to real.
5. We can extend the player number with very few modification.
'''Working:''' 
* Initially player enter their names
* First turn is  randomly selected with the help of random.randint functionality.
* Snake and Ladder function will be called with every turn. These function just check whether player reach any predefined ladder or snake position. If so, they print the msg. 
  - Snake name will be randomly selected from list while printing the msg.
* If player reached the 100 block as per player and 9,9 index of matrix. Player will be declared winner and program will be terminated.
* If both player attain the same position. Player name will be concatenated. 
* Position function is used to update the player position after every dice roll.
* Fill function is used to previous position of player as it move to new position.
Bug: Once both player attend same position. Players positions are not properly visible on board once they both one turn at-least.

 ''')
import random
    
def dice():
    return random.randrange(1, 7)
def showboard():
    board.reverse()
    for i in range(10):
        for j in range(10):
            print(board[i][j], end = "    ")
        print("\n")
    board.reverse()
def position(pos, p, old):
   
    col = int(pos%10)
    row = int(pos/10)
    if row%2 == 0:   
        o_number = board[row][col]
        board[row][col] = p        
    else:
        temp = []
        for i in range(10):
            temp.append(board[row][i])
        temp.reverse()
        o_number = temp[col]
        temp[col] = p
        temp.reverse()
        for i in range(10):
            board[row][i] = temp[i]
    try:
        old = int(old) - 1       
        if old <= 0:
            exit
        else:
            fill(old)
    except ValueError:
        exit                                                       
    return o_number

def fill(pos):        
    col = int(pos)%10
    row = int(pos/10)
    if row%2 == 0:   
        board[row][col] = pos+1        
    else:
        temp = []
        for i in range(10):
            temp.append(board[row][i])
        temp.reverse()
        temp[col] = pos+1
        temp.reverse()
        for i in range(10):
            board[row][i]=temp[i]

def snake(pos, p, old):
    con = False
    a = ["King Kobra", "Anaconda", "Rattlesnake", "Death Adder", "Black Mamba" ]
    s_list= [32, 52, 78, 98]
    m_list= [2, 15, 23, 8]
    snake_l = random.choice(a)
    for i in range(len(s_list)):
        if s_list[i] == pos:
            pos = m_list[i]
            print("Oooppss!!! you just bitten by",snake_l,"and slide from", s_list[i], "to", pos)
            con = True
            position(pos-1, p, old)
    return pos-1, con      
            
def ladder(pos, p, old):
    con = False
    s_ladder = [7, 23, 41, 68]
    m_ladder = [29, 74, 93, 89]
    for i in range(len(s_ladder)):
        if s_ladder[i] == pos:
            pos = m_ladder[i]
            print("Waaooo!!! you just found a ladder and climbed from", s_ladder[i], "to", pos)
            con = True
            position(pos-1, p, old)
    return pos-1, con

            p2position, scon = snake(p2position+1, p2, o_number2)
            p2position, lcon = ladder(p2position+1, p2, o_number2)
            if scon == True or lcon == True:
                T = 0
                exit
            else:
                if p2position == 99:
                    print(p2, "has won the game")
                    win = False
                elif p1position == p2position and p1position < 99 and p2position < 99:
                    o_number2 = position(p2position, p1+p2, o_number2)
                    T = 0
                elif p2position > 99:
                    p2position = p2position - p2number
                    T =0
                else:
                    o_number2 = position(p2position, p2, o_number2)
                    T = 0
        elif b == "show":
            showboard()
        else:
            print("Enter valid input")

=== Spiral Traversal of Matrix Textually === Steps to print the matrix 'a' with rows 'm' and columns 'n' 
1. Initialise the index for row and column (k = 0 and l = 0)
2. Repeat step 3 through step 6 till the rows and columns are exhausted
3. Print k th row; Increment k to next row
4. Print the (n-1)th column; decrement n by one (Shrink the matrix by one column)
5. If rows of the matrix not exhausted, Print m th row (last row); Decrement m by one (Shrink the matrix by one row)
6. If columns of the matrix not exhausted, Print the first column in reverse manner; Increment the column index to 
   look for next column
Program 
def spiral(m,n,a):                         # m - row, n - column and a- matrix to print
    k=0                                    # k = index of starting row
    l=0                                    # l = index of starting column 
    while(k

== GPS Tracker By Ms.Ami Tusharkant Choksi ==
=== Introduction ===
We want to track a person. For that, GPS(Global Positioning System) tracker is useful. The output of GPS tracker is in the form of latitude and longitude. They are the real numbers, that we cannot understand easily. To make it understandable easily, if places of those locations with names as text and map is shown, humans can understand very easily. That's what we are implementing here. 
=== Explanation for Code ===
---
To implement GPS tracker in Python language, we need 

    

  • csv file, wherein latitude and longitude are available
    • 

  • gmplot python module should be install
    • 

  • generate HTML file, that contains the Google map output of all data of route.csv file

  • browser wherein we will see output
    • 


---

=== Contents of route.csv ===
route.csv file, as shared by Amitsir, is having data in the following format.

28.689519,77.324495
28.689431,77.324347
28.689316,77.324165
28.689285,77.324062
28.689218,77.323948
28.689343,77.323858
28.689431,77.323807


---

=== Read csv file ===
Import the csv module and using the reader get values of longtitude and latitude from file.

import csv
reader = csv.reader(f)
    k=0
    for row in reader:
        lat = float(row[0])
        long = float(row[1])



=== Use of gmplot module ===
Check whether gmplot is installed or not on your system. For that on your python shell, write, 

from gmplot import gmplot


If it, gives any error, it means, gmplot module is not installed on your machine. One can install gmplot using

pip3 install gmplot


on Ubuntu or linux compatible machines. The required code for generating HTML file, from google map is as follows:


# import gmplot package 
import gmplot 
  
# GoogleMapPlotter return Map object 
# Pass the center latitude and 
# center longitude 
gmap = gmplot.GoogleMapPlotter(28.689169, 77.324448,17)
#set icon set Google marker icon
gmap.coloricon = "http://www.googlemapsmarkers.com/v1/%s/"

gmap.marker(lat,long,'yellow') #setting the marker of yellow color for start

 
Setting the marker for start as yellow color, last as red and others as blue color.

 Generate the HTML file that has the google map output of all data of route.csv file


gmap.draw("mymap.html")

---

=== Code ===

#check if module is available or not

from gmplot import gmplot
gmap = gmplot.GoogleMapPlotter(28.689169, 77.324448,17)
gmap.coloricon = "http://www.googlemapsmarkers.com/v1/%s/"
        
with open("route.csv","r") as f:
    reader = csv.reader(f)
    k=0
    for row in reader:
        lat = float(row[0])
        long = float(row[1])
        #print(lat)
        #print(long)
        #print()
        if(k==0):
            gmap.marker(lat,long,'yellow')
            k=1
        else:
            gmap.marker
            (lat,long,'blue')
gmap.marker(lat,long,'red')            
gmap.draw("mymap.html")

== Snakes and Ladders By Ms.Ami Tusharkant Choksi == ==== Introduction ==== Snakes and ladders is a very popular game. Two or more players can play the game together. '''Board:''' The game is having board with numbers ranging from 1 to 100. Snakes and ladders are placed on the board in any direction, ranging from any number to any other number on the board.
'''Player:''' Each player has to roll a dice. Position of player, e.g. player1's cookie will be placed on new position, i.e. calculated from 
new position=current position + diceNumber
'''Snake or Ladder:''' There can be snake or ladder on the new position. If snake is there, user has to go down to the position of snake's tail. If ladder is there, user will reach to the position of top of the ladder. '''Win or loose:''' A player who reaches the number 100 on the board first, wins the game. === Explanation for the Code: === Vidyamam, in the lecture, taught us to create a board by loading the image on it. How players play and their position on the board is getting incremented by the dice generated number. She left the code for checking snake/ladder for us, that too i have implemented here, with a simple logic. --- ==== Show board ==== 
#show board image in a window
def show_board():
    img=Image.open('SNL.jpg')
    img.show()
--- [[File:SNL.jpg]] --- ==== Play ==== Explanation: Playing is, one by one, user will roll a dice. i.e. here we will generate random no. For that importing random is required. --- 
#play
def play():
    #input player names
    p1Name=input("Player1 Name : ")
    p2Name=input("Players Name : ")
    #initial points of players
    p1=0
    p2=0
    turn=0
    while(1):
        if(turn%2==0):
            print(p1Name, " Your turn")
            c = input("Press 1 to continue, 0 to exit : ")
            if(c==0):
                print(p1Name," Scored : ",p1)
                print(p2Name," Scored : ",p2)
                print("Quiting the game, bye")
                break
            #generate random number for dice
            dice = random.randint(1,6)
            print("Dice showed : ",dice)
            
            p1 = p1+dice
            p1 += check_snakeLadder()
            #after snake if, p1 becomes negative, make it 0,
            #as -ve is not available on board
            if(p1<0):
                p1=0
            
            if p1>end:
                p1=end
            print(p1Name, " Your Score : ",p1)
            if(reached_end(p1)):
                print(p1Name, " won")
                break
        else:
            print(p2Name, " Your turn")
            c = input("Press 1 to continue, 0 to exit : ")
            if(c==0):
                print(p1Name," Scored : ",p1)
                print(p2Name," Scored : ",p2)
                print("Quiting the game, bye")
                break
            #generate random number for dice
            dice = random.randint(1,6)
            print("Dice showed : ",dice)
            
            p2 = p2+dice
            p2 += check_snakeLadder() 
            #after snake if, p1 becomes negative, make it 0,
            #as -ve is not available on board
            if(p2<0):
                p2=0
            
            if p2>end:
                p2=end
            print(p2Name, " Your Score : ",p2)
            if(reached_end(p2)):
                print(p2Name, " won")
                break
        turn+=1
--- ==== Check for Snake or Ladder, End ==== A simple logic i have implemented here, which, mam left, for us to implement. When user rolls the dice, we will add new position to current position plus, number generated on dice. Now, we have to check whether,
  1. it is end or not, if it is end, the player wins.
    2. def reached_end(p):
    if(p>=end):
        return True
    return False
  2. it is snake, go down to the tail of snake
  3. it is ladder, to up to the top of ladder

#check whether snake or ladder is there or not
def check_snakeLadder():
    snakeLadder = random.randint(2,80)
    divisor = random.randint(2,9)
    #if ladder is there, return +snakeLadder
    if(snakeLadder % divisor == 0):
        print("Wow Ladder : ", snakeLadder)
        return(snakeLadder)
    #if snake is there, return -snakeLadder
    elif(snakeLadder % divisor > 5):
        print("Sorry Snake : ",snakeLadder)
        return(-snakeLadder)
    #neither snake or ladder is there
    else:
        print("Neither snake nor ladder : ")
        return 0

"""
Created on Tue Sep 11 11:59:28 2018
@author: amichoksi
"""
from PIL import Image
import random
end=100

#show board image in a window
def show_board():
    img=Image.open('SNL.jpg')
    img.show()
#check reach end
def reached_end(p):
    if(p>=end):
        return True
    return False
#check whether snake or ladder is there or not
def check_snakeLadder():
    snakeLadder = random.randint(2,80)
    divisor = random.randint(2,9)
    #if ladder is there, return +snakeLadder
    if(snakeLadder % divisor == 0):
        print("Wow Ladder : ", snakeLadder)
        return(snakeLadder)
    #if snake is there, return -snakeLadder
    elif(snakeLadder % divisor > 5):
        print("Sorry Snake : ",snakeLadder)
        return(-snakeLadder)
    #neither snake or ladder is there
    else:
        print("Neither snake nor ladder : ")
        return 0    
#play
def play():
    #input player names
    p1Name=input("Player1 Name : ")
    p2Name=input("Players Name : ")
    #initial points of players
    p1=0
    p2=0
    turn=0
    while(1):
        if(turn%2==0):
            print(p1Name, " Your turn")
            c = input("Press 1 to continue, 0 to exit : ")
            if(c==0):
                print(p1Name," Scored : ",p1)
                print(p2Name," Scored : ",p2)
                print("Quiting the game, bye")
                break
            #generate random number for dice
            dice = random.randint(1,6)
            print("Dice showed : ",dice)
            
            p1 = p1+dice
            p1 += check_snakeLadder()
            #after snake if, p1 becomes negative, make it 0,
            #as -ve is not available on board
            if(p1<0):
                p1=0
            
            if p1>end:
                p1=end
            print(p1Name, " Your Score : ",p1)
            if(reached_end(p1)):
                print(p1Name, " won")
                break
        else:
            print(p2Name, " Your turn")
            c = input("Press 1 to continue, 0 to exit : ")
            if(c==0):
                print(p1Name," Scored : ",p1)
                print(p2Name," Scored : ",p2)
                print("Quiting the game, bye")
                break
            #generate random number for dice
            dice = random.randint(1,6)
            print("Dice showed : ",dice)
            
            p2 = p2+dice
            p2 += check_snakeLadder() 
            #after snake if, p1 becomes negative, make it 0,
            #as -ve is not available on board
            if(p2<0):
                p2=0
            
            if p2>end:
                p2=end
            print(p2Name, " Your Score : ",p2)
            if(reached_end(p2)):
                print(p2Name, " won")
                break
        turn+=1
#calling the board and play methods

play()

--- ---- == Snake and Ladder By Sachin == ---- Following code is designed to play old and classic game "Sankes and Ladder" '''Rules:''' 
1. Both players start from Zero
2. Each player get a chance to roll a dice one by one.
3. Player have to move forward(steps) as number comes on the dice.
4. there are 2 obstacle in path Snakes and Ladders. 
    * Ladder: Once any player reached the ladder point He will climb up and gain extra steps.
    * Snake: Once any player reached the snake point. He will move downward and lose the steps. 
5. The player who reached the 100 block first will be winner.
'''Features:''' 
1. Player turn is randomly selected first time.
2. Player can use "Show" to see the board and their position.
3. The numbers on board are arranged in a zig zag manner as we see on original board.
4. Board block structure is almost near to real.
5. We can extend the player number with very few modification.
'''Working:''' 
* Initially player enter their names
* First turn is  randomly selected with the help of random.randint functionality.
* Snake and Ladder function will be called with every turn. These function just check whether player reach any predefined ladder or snake position. If so, they print the msg. 
  - Snake name will be randomly selected from list while printing the msg.
* If player reached the 100 block as per player and 9,9 index of matrix. Player will be declared winner and program will be terminated.
* If both player attain the same position. Player name will be concatenated. 
* Position function is used to update the player position after every dice roll.
* Fill function is used to previous position of player as it move to new position.
Bug: Once both player attend same position. Players positions are not properly visible on board once they both one turn at-least. 
print('''
  ____              _                          _   _              _     _           
 / ___| _ __   __ _| | _____    __ _ _ __   __| | | |    __ _  __| | __| | ___ _ __ 
 \___ \| '_ \ / _` | |/ / _ \  / _` | '_ \ / _` | | |   / _` |/ _` |/ _` |/ _ \ '__|
  ___) | | | | (_| |   <  __/ | (_| | | | | (_| | | |__| (_| | (_| | (_| |  __/ |   
 |____/|_| |_|\__,_|_|\_\___|  \__,_|_| |_|\__,_| |_____\__,_|\__,_|\__,_|\___|_|      
                                                                                                                                                                                     
 ''')
import random
    
def dice():
    return random.randrange(1, 7)
def showboard():
    board.reverse()
    for i in range(10):
        for j in range(10):
            print(board[i][j], end = "    ")
        print("\n")
    board.reverse()
def position(pos, p, old):
   
    col = int(pos%10)
    row = int(pos/10)
    if row%2 == 0:   
        o_number = board[row][col]
        board[row][col] = p        
    else:
        temp = []
        for i in range(10):
            temp.append(board[row][i])
        temp.reverse()
        o_number = temp[col]
        temp[col] = p
        temp.reverse()
        for i in range(10):
            board[row][i] = temp[i]
    try:
        old = int(old) - 1       
        if old <= 0:
            exit
        else:
            fill(old)
    except ValueError:
        exit                                                       
    return o_number

def fill(pos):        
    col = int(pos)%10
    row = int(pos/10)
    if row%2 == 0:   
        board[row][col] = pos+1        
    else:
        temp = []
        for i in range(10):
            temp.append(board[row][i])
        temp.reverse()
        temp[col] = pos+1
        temp.reverse()
        for i in range(10):
            board[row][i]=temp[i]

def snake(pos, p, old):
    con = False
    a = ["King Kobra", "Anaconda", "Rattlesnake", "Death Adder", "Black Mamba" ]
    s_list= [32, 52, 78, 98]
    m_list= [2, 15, 23, 8]
    snake_l = random.choice(a)
    for i in range(len(s_list)):
        if s_list[i] == pos:
            pos = m_list[i]
            print("Oooppss!!! you just bitten by",snake_l,"and slide from", s_list[i], "to", pos)
            con = True
            position(pos-1, p, old)
    return pos-1, con      
            
def ladder(pos, p, old):
    con = False
    s_ladder = [7, 23, 41, 68]
    m_ladder = [29, 74, 93, 89]
    for i in range(len(s_ladder)):
        if s_ladder[i] == pos:
            pos = m_ladder[i]
            print("Waaooo!!! you just found a ladder and climbed from", s_ladder[i], "to", pos)
            con = True
            position(pos-1, p, old)
    return pos-1, con   

p1 = input("Player one enter your name\n")
p2 = input("Player Two enter your name\n")

        s += 1
        tboard.append(s)
    if i%2 == 0:
        board.append(tboard)
    else:
        tboard.reverse()
        board.append(tboard)

                exit
            else:

                    print(p1, "has won the game \a")

        elif a == "show":

                else:
